commit_message:
Add support for keystone projects

Lo and behold, there are potential differences in the field in what one
has to do to manage keystone projects.

Change-Id: Iced2c5dde8a91451e2cfeed50742ed3d6fdbf2f4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/41/159941/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystoneclient import client as keystone_client self._keystone_client = None def keystone_client(self): if self._keystone_client is None: try: endpoint = self.get_endpoint( service_type=self.get_service_type('identity')) self._keystone_client = keystone_client.Client( session=self.keystone_session, endpoint=endpoint, cert=self.cert) except Exception as e: self.log.debug( "Couldn't construct keystone object", exc_info=True) raise OpenStackCloudException( "Error constructing keystone client: %s" % e.message) return self._keystone_client @property @property def project_cache(self): @self._cache.cache_on_arguments() def _project_cache(): return {project.id: project for project in self._project_manager.list()} return _project_cache() @property def _project_manager(self): # Keystone v2 calls this attribute tenants # Keystone v3 calls it projects # Yay for usable APIs! return getattr( self.keystone_client, 'projects', self.keystone_client.tenants) def _get_project(self, name_or_id): """Retrieve a project by name or id.""" for id, project in self.project_cache.items(): if name_or_id in (id, project.name): return project return None def get_project(self, name_or_id): """Retrieve a project by name or id.""" project = self._get_project(name_or_id) if project: return meta.obj_to_dict(project) return None def update_project(self, name_or_id, description=None, enabled=True): try: project = self._get_project(name_or_id) return meta.obj_to_dict( project.update(description=description, enabled=enabled)) except Exception as e: self.log.debug("keystone update project issue", exc_info=True) raise OpenStackCloudException( "Error in updating project {project}: {message}".format( project=name_or_id, message=e.message)) def create_project(self, name, description=None, enabled=True): """Create a project.""" try: self._project_manager.create( project_name=name, description=description, enabled=enabled) except Exception as e: self.log.debug("keystone create project issue", exc_info=True) raise OpenStackCloudException( "Error in creating project {project}: {message}".format( project=name, message=e.message)) def delete_project(self, name_or_id): try: project = self._get_project(name_or_id) self._project_manager.delete(project.id) except Exception as e: self.log.debug("keystone delete project issue", exc_info=True) raise OpenStackCloudException( "Error in deleting project {project}: {message}".format( project=name_or_id, message=e.message))

commit_message:
Rename _continue_deploy() to pass_deploy_info()

For historic reasons the method called by the bash ramdisk to continue the
deployment was called _continue_deploy() (in code) but is exposed on the
API as "pass_deploy_info" (.../vendor_passthru/pass_deploy_info). The
vendor interface for IPA contains a method called continue_deploy()
(without the '_' prefix) and since we got the pxe_* drivers to work
with both ramdisks the name of both methods was causing some confusion,
because the only difference between them was the '_' prefix but they
are not related at all.

So this patch is now renaming the _continue_deploy() methods to
pass_deploy_info (same name it's exposed on the API) to improve the code
readibility of the vendor interface.

Change-Id: I4d909a31585eedbec2df2cd3575f658c1cb0d0aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/83/164783/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix up and document input parameters

In walking through fixing SSL parameters, it became clear that we have
several confusing or vestigal parameters. Walk through and fix them all
to make them clearer. Also - let people pass through params through the
openstack_clouds code path.

Change-Id: Idc5823ed470e3f973a23504db9d7b179396690e8

Depending on the value of auth_plugin, the contents of this dict can vary wildly. :param string region_name: The region of the cloud that all operations should be performed against. (optional, default '') :param string endpoint_type: The type of endpoint to get for services from the service catalog. Valid types are `public` ,`internal` or `admin`. (optional, defaults to `public`) :param bool private: Whether to return or use private IPs by default for servers. (optional, defaults to False) def __init__(self, name, auth, region_name='', endpoint_type='public', private=False, self.name = name self.auth = auth self.region_name = region_name self.endpoint_type = endpoint_type self.private = private (self.verify, self.cert) = _ssl_args(verify, cacert, cert, key) if debug:

commit_message:
Implement poll util and plugin poll util

Implemented polling utils module. Also added simple
usage of plugin util for decommissioning datanodes for
Spark plugin.

partially implements bp: add-timeouts-for-polling

Change-Id: I62c4cd92925d0d09bd529cb1103519d3d84c2f1f

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 Mirantis Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_utils import timeutils from sahara import exceptions as ex from sahara.i18n import _ from sahara.i18n import _LI from sahara import context CONF = cfg.CONF # No opts here now timeouts_opts = [ ] CONF.register_opts(timeouts_opts) LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def _get_consumed(started_at): return timeutils.delta_seconds(started_at, timeutils.utcnow()) def _write_to_log(poll_description, extra=None): timeout = poll_description.get('timeout', 86400) operation = poll_description.get('operation', None) if operation: desc = _("Operation with name {name}").format(name=operation) else: desc = _("Operation") if not extra: LOG.info(_LI("{operation_description} was executed successfully in " "timeout {timeout}").format(operation_description=desc, timeout=timeout)) return reason = extra.get('reason', _("unspecified reason")) LOG.info(_LI("{operation_description} was stopped because of " "reason: {reason}").format(operation_description=desc, reason=reason)) def poll(obj, get_status, poll_description, extra_spec=None): started_at = timeutils.utcnow() operation = poll_description.get('operation', None) timeout_name = poll_description.get('timeout_name', None) # set 1 day timeout by default timeout = poll_description.get('timeout', 86400) sleep_time = poll_description.get('sleep', 5) extra_execution = None if extra_spec: extra_execution = extra_spec.get('execution', None) while _get_consumed(started_at) < timeout: if get_status(obj): # stop polling because of success result _write_to_log(poll_description) return if extra_execution: if extra_execution(obj): # stop poll because of extra reasons (for example, cluster # was deleted). _write_to_log(poll_description, extra_spec) return context.sleep(sleep_time) raise ex.TimeoutException(timeout, operation, timeout_name)

commit_message:
Revert "IBP: calculate checksums for images after building them"

This reverts commit 2a1c7ad40c7a86f8338501745eb9cee69b380f30.

Change-Id: Iaa280e403b858844bc95c488a38574a573a68552

commit_message:
Remove memcached configuration from swift task

We configure memcached in a separate task so there's no need to do
the same in openstack::swift::proxy class, unless we moved swift to
the separate role.

Fix pre- post- tests for swift and memcached:
 * Add memcached process check for swift post test
 * Add testcase for memcached should not listen for public ip

DocImpact: (Ops guide) if the memcached service was restarted, the
  keystone service must be restarted next as well.

Change-Id: I5e965f12e5ba0003004ae10442d63c358a104367
Related-bug: #1432242

Change-Id: I722e12cf236ae390223534ef720cd242dc973c36
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

subject: Refactor notification
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-19 15:37:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnetodb/commit/f104dba49c64ddd4cc8418587ab83dc82f120a93', 'message': '(WIP)Add real time request metrics

To proactively address MagnetoDB operational issues, admin user needs
real time visibility to request metrics data for each category of REST
API calls on each API node. Such as:
- number of requests
- number of errors
- API call latencies
- rate of requests
- distribution of requests
- etc.

Statsd is used to collect counters and timing metrics.

A middleware is introduced to monitor request metrics at API node level.
For a particular category of API calls, the request metrics are collected
at API controller level. For asynchronous requests such as table create/
delete, existing notification mechanism will be used to send metrics to
Statsd.

Change-Id: I7c55e4385fd8337256ee6a7b6b884dfbbebb0a2c
Implements: blueprint request-metrics

To proactively address MagnetoDB operational issues, admin user needs
real time visibility to request metrics data for each category of REST
API calls on each API node. Such as:
- number of requests
- number of errors
- API call latencies
- rate of requests
- distribution of requests
- etc.

Statsd is used to collect counters and timing metrics.

A middleware is introduced to monitor request metrics at API node level.
For asynchronous requests such as table create/delete, explicit notifications
will be used to send events and StatsD metrics.

A new notifier is introduced to send events and/or StatsD metrics,
depending on the event type. Notification is refactored to use the new
notifier.

Change-Id: I7c55e4385fd8337256ee6a7b6b884dfbbebb0a2c
Implements: blueprint request-metrics refactor-notification

'}, {'number': 16, 'created': '2015-02-13 21:10:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnetodb/commit/057f965b1388dd4a9366b3bd8ea42aa0ed7e6416', 'message': 'Add real time request metrics and refactor notification

To proactively address MagnetoDB operational issues, admin user needs
real time visibility to request metrics data for each category of REST
API calls on each API node. Such as:
- number of requests
- number of errors
- API call latencies
- rate of requests
- distribution of requests
- etc.

Statsd is used to collect counters and timing metrics.

A middleware is introduced to monitor request metrics at API node level.
For asynchronous requests such as table create/delete, explicit notifications
will be used to send events and StatsD metrics.

A new notifier is introduced to send events and/or StatsD metrics,
depending on the event type. Notification is refactored to use the new
notifier.

Change-Id: I7c55e4385fd8337256ee6a7b6b884dfbbebb0a2c
Implements: blueprint request-metrics refactor-notification
'}, {'number': 17, 'created': '2015-02-18 15:02:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnetodb/commit/a9b77c004732cce3f9346449e2fc9f208f56ae32', 'message': 'Add real time request metrics and refactor notification

To proactively address MagnetoDB operational issues, admin user needs
real time visibility to request metrics data for each category of REST
API calls on each API node. Such as:
- number of requests
- number of errors
- API call latencies
- rate of requests
- distribution of requests
- etc.

Statsd is used to collect counters and timing metrics.

A middleware is introduced to emit request metrics for all data API calls using
a refactored notifier. For asynchronous requests such as table create/delete,
explicit notifications will be used to send events and StatsD metrics.

A new notifier is introduced to send events and/or StatsD metrics,
depending on the event type defined in a central event registry. Notification
is refactored to use the new notifier.

Change-Id: I7c55e4385fd8337256ee6a7b6b884dfbbebb0a2c
Implements: blueprint request-metrics blueprint refactor-notification

commit_message:
Refactor notification

A middleware is introduced to send all API request level notifications using
a refactored notifier. For asynchronous requests such as table create/delete,
explicit notifications will be used to send events.

Change-Id: I7c55e4385fd8337256ee6a7b6b884dfbbebb0a2c
Implements: blueprint refactor-notification

commit_message:
Add missing openstacklib fixture

openstackclient lib/provider are now migrated from keystone to openstacklib
let's add openstacklib as a new dependency.

Change-Id: I1854e18ecf6497daef70bccef46e5d6cb7c0b819

Co-Authored-By: Qiming Teng <tengqim@cn.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I65e1032e84b40cb7ae3126fa6b63c914988cc970
Implements: blueprint convergence-resource-table
'}]
commit_message:
Add extra columns for resource table

This patch adds following columns for resource table:
- `needed_by` (a list of Resource keys)
- `requires` (a list of Resource keys)
- `replaces` (a single Resource key, Null by default)
- `replaced_by` (a single Resource key, Null by default)
- `current_template_id` (a single RawTemplate key)

Co-Authored-by: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Qiming Teng <tengqim@cn.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I65e1032e84b40cb7ae3126fa6b63c914988cc970
Implements: blueprint convergence-resource-table

commit_message:
Set timeout bigger for wait image status

If our test server is under load,
test create/update/ delete image via glnce v1 failed by timeout

So set timeout bigger, to avoid false positive result in bvt

Change-Id: I94e146d3f84c3dec623714ba9ec57c6723806fda
Closes-Bug: #1431858

commit_message:
Fix db2 upgrade in multi-thread run issue

In multi-thread run cases(like chef recipes run), it would hit insert same
record issue, this fix make sure insert different data in db, thus not hit
duplicated insert issue, it is mainly improve in multi-thread cases run.

Change-Id: I1690dc5863cbd2b213d241477e23e82d295856fe
Closes-Bug: #1427997

added_lines: def _generate_random_str(self, str_len): objectid_len = len(str(bson.objectid.ObjectId())) init_str = str(bson.objectid.ObjectId()) if str_len < objectid_len: return init_str else: init_str = ''.join(( str(bson.objectid.ObjectId()) * int(str_len/objectid_len), 'x' * int(str_len - str_len/objectid_len * objectid_len))) return init_str resource_id = self._generate_random_str( cfg.CONF.database.db2nosql_resource_id_maxlen)
deleted_lines: resource_id = 'x' * cfg.CONF.database.db2nosql_resource_id_maxlen

Make check_uuid executable

Check_uuid is a script and not a module. This makes it executable
from CLI.

commit_message:
Move mlnx agent to be under ml2/drivers/mlnx

* move the mlnx agent to be under ml2/drivers/mlnx
* update the main entry point to be under cmd
* remove unused vnic_type parameter in agent config

Partially-implements: blueprint core-vendor-decomposition

Change-Id: Ibbb99de3124d5d81bbccbc06b33ce32b19c1daef

commit_message:
IBP: calculate checksums for images after building them

In order to ensure image data integrity, build script should calculate
checksums and place them into yaml

Partially implements: blueprint ibp-image-checksums

Change-Id: Ibc2412aa48134d4b340c3694b89fd4d221c2f72b

added_lines: filename = os.path.basename(urlparse.urlsplit(v['uri'])[2]) abs_path = os.path.join(json_data['output'], filename) (stdout, _, _) = execute('gunzip', '-ql', abs_path) try: size = int(stdout.split()[1]) except (ValueError, KeyError) as e: size = None (stdout, _, _) = execute('gunzip', '-qc', abs_path, '|', 'md5sum') try: md5 = stdout.split()[0] except (ValueError, KeyError) as e: md5 = None data.append({k: { 'md5': md5, 'size': size, 'filename': filename, data.append({'repos': json_data['repos']}) if ret_code == 0: create_yaml_profile(json_data)
deleted_lines: data.append({k: { 'filename': os.path.basename(urlparse.urlsplit(v['uri'])[2]), create_yaml_profile(json_data)

commit_message:
Remove depr SUBNET_ID from Neutron::VPNService

There is no need in SUBNET_ID in Neutron::VPNService resources,
so we can remove it.

Change-Id: Idbd8324ae43a04a13d2fce6fa116a529202c16d9

added_lines: def create_vpnservice(self): neutronV20.find_resourceid_by_name_or_id( mox.IsA(neutronclient.Client), 'subnet', 'sub123' ).AndReturn('sub123') snippet = template_format.parse(vpnservice_template) def test_create(self): rsrc = self.create_vpnservice()
deleted_lines: vpnservice_template_deprecated = ''' { "AWSTemplateFormatVersion" : "2010-09-09", "Description" : "Template to test VPN service resource", "Parameters" : {}, "Resources" : { "VPNService" : { "Type" : "OS::Neutron::VPNService", "Properties" : { "name" : "VPNService", "description" : "My new VPN service", "admin_state_up" : true, "router_id" : "rou123", "subnet_id" : "sub123" } } } } ''' def create_vpnservice(self, resolve_neutron=True): if resolve_neutron: neutronV20.find_resourceid_by_name_or_id( mox.IsA(neutronclient.Client), 'subnet', 'sub123' ).AndReturn('sub123') snippet = template_format.parse(vpnservice_template) else: snippet = template_format.parse(vpnservice_template_deprecated) def test_create_deprecated(self): self._test_create(resolve_neutron=False) def test_create(self): self._test_create() def _test_create(self, resolve_neutron=True): rsrc = self.create_vpnservice(resolve_neutron)

so we can remove it.

Remove depr prop SUBNET_ID from Neutron::Pool

There is no need anymore in SUBNET_ID property of
Neutron::Pool resource, so we can remove it.

commit_message:
Remove deprecated prop from Neutron::FloatingIP

There is no place except method add_dependencies, where
FLOATING_NETWORK_ID is used, so we can remove it.

Change-Id: I2bb1a01ebe5831b39bb485dfac018969c416d277

commit_message:
Fix ceilometer support for vCenter

- remove declaration of ceilometer::agent::compute class
- install ceilometer agent compute package on controller
- add datastore_regex parameter to vmware::ceilometer:ha_multi_hv in
  order to prevent puppet run execution failure ("Invalid parameter
  datastore_regex ...")

Change-Id: I8772189b6ce5c6db7c97e9ddbc2260ba10a1313f
Closes-bug: 1428736

commit_message:
Remove tag 2014.2-6.1 according new format is use

We start to use Available since deployment tag,
as result tests where tag was set in format like
'2014.2-6.1' stop to display on UI

Change-Id: I099290527c297aec5a823839088217de90ed1268
Closes-Bug: 1432702

commit_message:
Fix netns-cleanup broken by ProcessMonitor refactor

Change I0da6071037f9728cc20403324e36c32116bcf00d broke the
netns-cleanup script. As the process_monitor parameter
is now mandatory for the dhcp driver.

Change-Id: I69617c67815b71a05a25936c5e7acc7c116c0dd6
Closes-bug: #1430762

commit_message:
Add 'disabled_reason' in hypervisor schema

If os-hypervisor-status extension is enabled then,
'disabled_reason' is updated in 'service' dict of hypervisor
show and list detail API' response.

This patch adds 'disabled_reason' in their schema.

Change-Id: I98eb76cede2deeb188e3776a2f94a75f70f59725

So this is not required. commit_message:
Deleted check for compute nodes for vcenter

It is no need to check env for compute nodes for vcenter tests, because
there is a corresponding deployment tag("use_vcenter"). And vcenter env does
not required a compute nodes.

Change-Id: I314751b951a5571790370ea4c13022d056d76497
Closes-bug: #1431285

commit_message:
Implement provider for native linux briges support

Change-Id: Ic616ff6efe7e9e17b8bc55757004f7ee48ed336d
blueprint: refactor-l23-linux-bridges
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-specs refs/changes/75/142475/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================================== Add provider for native linux bridges to L23network =================================================== Related links: * https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/refactor-l23-linux-bridges * https://docs.google.com/a/mirantis.com/document/d/1QVoexrDF_MS92IZd4jnwPWQDxTAWMzUUrcMyu8VjGF4 Problem description =================== For network configuration FUEL use L23network puppet module. In this module no support for native linux bridges. Also support for native linux bonding implemented as part of Ifconfig resource, not as puppet provider for Bond resource. This blueprint proposed following changes: * implement provider for native linux bridging * implement provider for changing configuration files for Centos and Ubuntu * migrate from puppet template engine to FileMapper (l23_store_config custom type) Proposed change =============== L23network initial process -------------------------- Initial setup of L23network. Use_* and install_* parameters allow deployer to block some functionality and installing packets. It may need for highly customized configurations. .. code-block:: puppet class { 'l23network': use_ovs => true, install_ovs => true, use_lnx => true, install_brctl => true, } I propose, by default, to install all available packages and enable all base functionality. But it may be a cause for discussion. l23_store_config custom type ---------------------------- This resource implemented for changing part of config file by mappind according to given key/value mapping .. code-block:: puppet l23_store_config { "l2_$interafce": file => "ifcfg-$interface", config => { DEVICE => eth1, BRIDGE => br1, ONBOOT => yes, }, } Place of file location defined inside providerfor corresponded operation system. L2::Bridge ---------- Interface: .. code-block:: puppet l23network::l2::bridge { 'br1': ensure => present, external_ids => "bridge-id=${name}", provider => lnx, } Internals: Puppet definition l23network::l2::bridge contains: * call custom puppet type (l23_store_config) to change network interface configuration file. * call custom puppet type (l2_bridge) to configure bridge in runtime * make auto-require and auto-before for corresponded resources af it need. L2::Port -------- Just a port. All parameters will be specifyed later. L2::Bond -------- It's a special type of port. Designed for bonding two or more interfaces. Alternatives ------------ Leave it as-is. Upgrade open vSwitsh to latest LTS and pray. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: * Sergey Vasilenko (xenolog) <svasilenko@mirantis.com> Other contributors: * Stanislaw Bogatkin (sbogatkin) <sbogatkin@mirantis.com> * Dmitry Ilyin (idv1985) <dilyin@mirantis.com> Work Items ---------- * implement provider for change interface's config files. * implement providers for native linux resources: * bridge * port * bond Dependencies ============ * adrien/filemapper * puppetlabs/stdlib Testing ======= We will need to improve devops to support emulating multiple L2 domains so that systems tests can be run using this topology. Also will be better implement test cases for periodically run ones on bare-metal lab. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== * Transformations. How it work: https://docs.google.com/a/mirantis.com/document/d/1QVoexrDF_MS92IZd4jnwPWQDxTAWMzUUrcMyu8VjGF4

commit_message:
Revert "Set default of api_workers to number of CPUs"

This reverts commit c65175811baf29e75556045e3b44ab948e02a9c3.

This is in relation to:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1432065

Change-Id: I97562840ff57f43958c1e3e56aa41219bd01c8c5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-30 00:33:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/4a1f6bb552c79e2f08ebacdfd5a9fce230c9869f', 'message': '[WIP]IPsec strongswan driver implemention

This patch implements strongswan driver for VPNaaS,
and it is dependent on the patch [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/144388/

Implements blueprint ipsec-strongswan-driver
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ia3eb10a9103bdceb2a29f2372b410b946f3a89cc
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-12 15:52:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/ec96aff80639decf56620b521eea2b287e6d5329', 'message': 'IPsec strongSwan driver implemention

This patch implements strongWwan driver for VPNaaS,
Initial efforts only support strongSwan >= 5.x and
implement an equivalent psk net-to-net vpn service
as openSwan driver did based on recommended conf.

Implements blueprint ipsec-strongswan-driver
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ia3eb10a9103bdceb2a29f2372b410b946f3a89cc
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-01-13 01:50:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/bc7b2d17b4e0ff84f256cad85f0b81f42f1831e3', 'message': 'IPsec strongSwan driver implemention

This patch implements strongWwan driver for VPNaaS,
Initial efforts only support strongSwan >= 5.x and
implement an equivalent psk net-to-net vpn service
as openSwan driver did based on recommended conf.

Implements blueprint ipsec-strongswan-driver
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ia3eb10a9103bdceb2a29f2372b410b946f3a89cc
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-01-15 06:05:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/d5fd4112907b43ddaadb5ce7d1c22e6842e3986e', 'message': 'IPsec strongSwan driver implemention

This patch implements strongWan driver for VPNaaS, Initial effort
only supports strongSwan >= 5.x and implements an equivalent psk
net-to-net vpn service as openSwan driver did based on recommended
configuration.

Implements blueprint ipsec-strongswan-driver
DocImpact
a, Adding StrongswanDriver in the file etc/vpn_agent.ini
   vpn_device_driver=neutron_vpnaas.services.vpn.device_drivers \
   .strongswan_ipsec.StrongSwanDriver
b, Apparmor definition needs to be defined so that strongSwan can
   create vpn tunnel correctly, or you can just disable them by
   the following commands.
   apparmor_parser -R /etc/apparmor.d/usr.lib.ipsec.charon
   apparmor_parser -R /etc/apparmor.d/usr.lib.ipsec.stroke
c, Other steps are the same with openSwan driver.

Change-Id: Ia3eb10a9103bdceb2a29f2372b410b946f3a89cc
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2015-01-16 15:32:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/bf1c182caea784284d251445e53ef34b955a930a', 'message': "IPsec strongSwan driver implemention

This patch implements strongSwan driver for VPNaaS, Initial effort
only supports strongSwan >= 5.x and implements an equivalent psk
net-to-net vpn service as openSwan driver did based on recommended
configuration.

Implements blueprint ipsec-strongswan-driver
DocImpact
a, Both strongSwan and openSwan can't be installed at the same
   time, we're relying on this fact and are thus sharing the topic
   for RPC. so thus both shouldn't be enabled, for use in the
   future when flavors/STF support is available.
b, Adding StrongswanDriver in the file etc/vpn_agent.ini
   vpn_device_driver=neutron_vpnaas.services.vpn.device_drivers \
   .strongswan_ipsec.StrongSwanDriver
c, Apparmor definition needs to be defined so that strongSwan can
   create vpn tunnel correctly, or you can just disable them by
   the following commands.
   apparmor_parser -R /etc/apparmor.d/usr.lib.ipsec.charon
   apparmor_parser -R /etc/apparmor.d/usr.lib.ipsec.stroke
d, Other steps are the same with openSwan driver.

Change-Id: Ia3eb10a9103bdceb2a29f2372b410b946f3a89cc
"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2015-01-19 12:13:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/82da039230148abb17e15aa765505c99c325af0c', 'message': "IPsec strongSwan driver implemention

"}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2015-01-21 08:26:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/8193f87c35a514e627e0e5a7bc08a8c4f1174431', 'message': "IPsec strongSwan driver implemention

This patch implements strongSwan driver for VPNaaS, Initial effort
only supports strongSwan >= 5.x and implements an equivalent psk
net-to-net vpn service as openSwan driver did based on recommended
configuration.

Implements blueprint ipsec-strongswan-driver
DocImpact
a, Both strongSwan and openSwan can't be installed at the same
   time, we're relying on this fact and are thus sharing the topic
   for RPC. so thus both shouldn't be enabled, for use in the
   future when flavors/STF support is available.
b, Adding StrongswanDriver in the file etc/vpn_agent.ini
   vpn_device_driver=neutron_vpnaas.services.vpn.device_drivers \
   .strongswan_ipsec.StrongSwanDriver
c, Apparmor definition needs to be defined so that strongSwan can
   create vpn tunnel correctly, or you can just disable them by
   the following commands.
   apparmor_parser -R /etc/apparmor.d/usr.lib.ipsec.charon
   apparmor_parser -R /etc/apparmor.d/usr.lib.ipsec.stroke
d, Other steps are the same with openSwan driver.

"}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2015-01-21 10:22:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/d91d44d30dffa7bb4996498f204446616a904fd9', 'message': "IPsec strongSwan driver implemention

This patch implements strongSwan driver for VPNaaS, Initial effort
only supports strongSwan >= 5.x and implements an equivalent psk
net-to-net vpn service as openSwan driver did based on recommended
configuration.

Implements blueprint ipsec-strongswan-driver
DocImpact
a, Both strongSwan and openSwan can't be installed at the same
   time, we're relying on this fact and are thus sharing the topic
   for RPC. so thus both shouldn't be enabled, for use in the
   future when flavors/STF support is available.
b, Adding StrongswanDriver in the file etc/vpn_agent.ini
   vpn_device_driver=neutron_vpnaas.services.vpn.device_drivers \
   .strongswan_ipsec.StrongSwanDriver
c, Apparmor definition needs to be defined so that strongSwan can
   create vpn tunnel correctly, or you can just disable them by
   the following commands.
   apparmor_parser -R /etc/apparmor.d/usr.lib.ipsec.charon
   apparmor_parser -R /etc/apparmor.d/usr.lib.ipsec.stroke
d, Other steps are the same with openSwan driver.

This patch is based on patchset67 of nachi's initial vpnaas
implementation, many thanks to nachi.

Change-Id: Ia3eb10a9103bdceb2a29f2372b410b946f3a89cc

net-to-net vpn service as openSwan driver did based on recommended
configuration.

Implements blueprint ipsec-strongswan-driver

DocImpact
a, StrongSwan and openSwan cannot be installed at the same time.
   Thus, both cannot be enabled for use. In the future when
   flavors/STF support is available, this will still constrain
   the flavors which can be used together.
b, Adding StrongswanDriver in the file /etc/neutron/vpn_agent.ini
   vpn_device_driver=neutron.services.vpn.device_drivers \
   .strongswan_ipsec.StrongSwanDriver
c, Other steps are the same with existing openSwan driver.

This patch is based on patchset67 of nachi's initial vpnaas
implementation, many thanks to nachi.

Change-Id: Ia3eb10a9103bdceb2a29f2372b410b946f3a89cc

"}, {'number': 28, 'created': '2015-02-07 12:17:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/0a5b3f54e805bc1bdc5e26681025fe5525fdbe6e', 'message': "IPsec strongSwan driver implemention

This patch implements strongSwan driver for VPNaaS, Initial effort
only supports strongSwan >= 5.x and implements an equivalent psk
net-to-net vpn service as openSwan driver did based on recommended
configuration.

Implements blueprint ipsec-strongswan-driver

DocImpact
a, StrongSwan and openSwan cannot be installed at the same time.
   Thus, both cannot be enabled for use. In the future when
   flavors/STF support is available, this will still constrain
   the flavors which can be used together.
b, Adding StrongswanDriver in the file /etc/neutron/vpn_agent.ini
   vpn_device_driver=neutron.services.vpn.device_drivers \
       .strongswan_ipsec.StrongSwanDriver
c, Apparmor can interfere with both creation of tunnels and
   established tunnels, because it controls access to operating
   system resources. So please put the profile of charon and
   stroke into complain mode by :
   sudo apt-get install apparmor-utils
   sudo apparmor_parser -R usr.lib.ipsec.charon
   sudo apparmor_parser -R usr.lib.ipsec.stroke
   sudo ln -s /etc/apparmor.d/usr.lib.ipsec.charon \
       /etc/apparmor.d/disable/
   sudo ln -s /etc/apparmor.d/usr.lib.ipsec.stroke \
       /etc/apparmor.d/disable/
   sudo aa-complain usr.lib.ipsec.charon
   sudo aa-complain usr.lib.ipsec.stroke
   sudo service strongswan restart or start machine
   sudo aa-status
d, Other steps are the same with the existing openSwan driver.

This patch is based on patchset67 of nachi's initial vpnaas
implementation, many thanks to nachi.

Change-Id: Ia3eb10a9103bdceb2a29f2372b410b946f3a89cc

"}, {'number': 32, 'created': '2015-02-12 11:44:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/ea638be13af4d68aab3f94d2508deca7803a6b8a', 'message': "IPsec strongSwan driver implemention

This patch implements strongSwan driver for VPNaaS, Initial effort
only supports strongSwan >= 5.x and implements an equivalent psk
net-to-net vpn service as openSwan driver did based on recommended
configuration.

Implements blueprint ipsec-strongswan-driver

DocImpact
a, StrongSwan and openSwan cannot be installed at the same time.
   Thus, both cannot be enabled for use. In the future when
   flavors/STF support is available, this will still constrain
   the flavors which can be used together.
b, Adding StrongswanDriver in the file /etc/neutron/vpn_agent.ini
   vpn_device_driver=neutron.services.vpn.device_drivers \
       .strongswan_ipsec.StrongSwanDriver
c, Apparmor can interfere with both creation of tunnels and
   established tunnels, because it controls access to operating
   system resources. Thus we can use below commands to remove
   apparmor definitions from the kernel.
     sudo apparmor_parser -R usr.lib.ipsec.charon
     sudo apparmor_parser -R usr.lib.ipsec.stroke
   However, what we are seeing is that even though we disable the
   profile for charon and stroke, apparmor is re-enabling them
   (at unknown times). As a result, we'd better put the profile
   of charon and stroke into complain mode by :
     sudo apt-get install apparmor-utils
     sudo aa-complain usr.lib.ipsec.charon
     sudo aa-complain usr.lib.ipsec.stroke
   Remember to use 'sudo aa-status' command to double confirm
   that both charon and stroke processes have been in complain
   mode. If there are any problems do not rule out to restart the
   machine. All in all, make sure run vpn service before apparmor
   is configured correctly.
d, Other steps are the same with the existing openSwan driver.

This patch is based on patchset67 of nachi's initial vpnaas
implementation, many thanks to nachi.

Change-Id: Ia3eb10a9103bdceb2a29f2372b410b946f3a89cc

c, Apparmor can interfere with both creation of tunnels and
   established tunnels, because it controls access to operating
   system resources. Thus we can use below commands to remove
   apparmor definitions from the kernel.
     sudo apparmor_parser -R usr.lib.ipsec.charon
     sudo apparmor_parser -R usr.lib.ipsec.stroke
   However, what we are seeing is that even though we disable the
   profile for charon and stroke, apparmor is re-enabling them
   (at unknown times). As a result, we'd better put the profile
   of charon and stroke into complain mode by :
     sudo apt-get install apparmor-utils
     sudo aa-complain usr.lib.ipsec.charon
     sudo aa-complain usr.lib.ipsec.stroke
   Remember to use 'sudo aa-status' command to double confirm
   that both charon and stroke processes have been in complain
   mode. If there are any problems do not rule out to restart the
   machine.
d, Other steps are the same with the existing openSwan driver.

This patch is based on patchset67 of nachi's initial vpnaas
implementation, many thanks to nachi.

Change-Id: Ia3eb10a9103bdceb2a29f2372b410b946f3a89cc

DocImpact

   Thus, both cannot be enabled for use. In the future when
   flavors/STF support is available, this will still constrain
   the flavors which can be used together.
b, Adding StrongswanDriver in the file /etc/neutron/vpn_agent.ini
   vpn_device_driver=neutron.services.vpn.device_drivers \
       .strongswan_ipsec.StrongSwanDriver
c, Apparmor can interfere with both creation of tunnels and
   established tunnels, because it controls access to operating
   system resources. Thus we can use below commands to remove
   apparmor definitions from the kernel.
     sudo apparmor_parser -R usr.lib.ipsec.charon
     sudo apparmor_parser -R usr.lib.ipsec.stroke
   However, what we are seeing is that even though we disable the
   profile for charon and stroke, apparmor is re-enabling them
   (at unknown times). As a result, we'd better put the profile
   of charon and stroke into complain mode by :
     sudo apt-get install apparmor-utils
     sudo aa-complain usr.lib.ipsec.charon
     sudo aa-complain usr.lib.ipsec.stroke
   Remember to use 'sudo aa-status' command to double confirm
   that both charon and stroke processes have been in complain
   mode. If there are any problems do not rule out to restart the

"}, {'number': 41, 'created': '2015-02-27 11:10:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/7c85ab81d006a9b36bb3c593b01e39eb1763c111', 'message': "IPsec strongSwan driver implemention

This patch implements strongSwan driver for VPNaaS, Initial effort
only supports strongSwan >= 5.x and implements an equivalent psk
net-to-net vpn service as openSwan driver did based on recommended
configuration.

Implements blueprint ipsec-strongswan-driver

DocImpact
a, StrongSwan and openSwan cannot be installed at the same time.
   Thus, both cannot be enabled for use. In the future when
   flavors/STF support is available, this will still constrain
   the flavors which can be used together.
b, Adding StrongswanDriver in the file /etc/neutron/vpn_agent.ini
   vpn_device_driver=neutron.services.vpn.device_drivers \
       .strongswan_ipsec.StrongSwanDriver
c, Apparmor can interfere with both creation of tunnels and
   established tunnels, because it controls access to operating
   system resources. Thus we can use below commands to remove
   apparmor definitions from the kernel.
     sudo apparmor_parser -R usr.lib.ipsec.charon
     sudo apparmor_parser -R usr.lib.ipsec.stroke
   However, what we are seeing is that even though we disable the
   profile for charon and stroke, apparmor is re-enabling them
   (at unknown times).
   The official site recommends to put the profiles of charon and
   stroke into complain mode by:
     sudo apt-get install apparmor-utils
     sudo aa-complain usr.lib.ipsec.charon
     sudo aa-complain usr.lib.ipsec.stroke
   But above complain mode can hit one bug [2] (Connect to socket
   failed: Permission denied), so we have to directly disable them
   by the following commands:
     sudo ln -s /etc/apparmor.d/usr.lib.ipsec.charon \
         /etc/apparmor.d/disable/
     sudo ln -s /etc/apparmor.d/usr.lib.ipsec.stroke \
         /etc/apparmor.d/disable/
     sudo invoke-rc.d apparmor reload
   The command 'sudo invoke-rc.d apparmor reload' can work well
   in ubuntu 14.04, unfortunately,  it can't work in ubuntu 14.10,
   see the bug [3], in ubuntu 14.10 can use
   'sudo start apparmor ACTION=reload' as a workaround.
   For these experiments can reference the link [4].
   In a word, you need to take care of your apparmor configurations.
d, Other steps are the same with the existing openSwan driver.

[1] https://help.ubuntu.com/community/AppArmor
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/apparmor/+bug/1244157
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/apparmor/+bug/1387220
[4] http://paste.openstack.org/show/182946/

This patch is based on patchset67 of nachi's initial vpnaas
implementation, many thanks to nachi.

Change-Id: Ia3eb10a9103bdceb2a29f2372b410b946f3a89cc
"}, {'number': 42, 'created': '2015-02-27 15:57:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/34d5558127bba39b410a08763829d546692febfc', 'message': "IPsec strongSwan driver implemention

DocImpact
a, StrongSwan and openSwan cannot be installed at the same time.
   Thus, both cannot be enabled for use. In the future when
   flavors/STF support is available, this will still constrain
   the flavors which can be used together.
b, Adding StrongswanDriver in the file /etc/neutron/vpn_agent.ini
   vpn_device_driver=neutron.services.vpn.device_drivers \
       .strongswan_ipsec.StrongSwanDriver
c, Apparmor can interfere with both creation of tunnels and
   established tunnels, because it controls access to operating
   system resources. Thus we can use below commands to remove
   apparmor definitions from the kernel.
     sudo apparmor_parser -R usr.lib.ipsec.charon
     sudo apparmor_parser -R usr.lib.ipsec.stroke
   However, what we are seeing is that even though we disable the
   profile for charon and stroke, apparmor is re-enabling them

         /etc/apparmor.d/disable/
     sudo service apparmor restart
   In a word, you need to take care of your apparmor configurations.
d, We can take two approaches, support both operating systems.
   but this patch only do ubuntu and then do a follow up for fedora.
e, Other steps are the same with the existing openSwan driver.

This patch is based on patchset67 of nachi's initial vpnaas

Change-Id: Ia3eb10a9103bdceb2a29f2372b410b946f3a89cc

This patch implements strongSwan driver for VPNaaS, Initial effort
only supports strongSwan >= 5.x and implements an equivalent psk
net-to-net vpn service as openSwan driver did based on recommended
configuration.

Implements blueprint ipsec-strongswan-driver

DocImpact
a, StrongSwan and openSwan cannot be installed at the same time.
   Thus, both cannot be enabled for use. In the future when
   flavors/STF support is available, this will still constrain
   the flavors which can be used together.
b, Adding StrongswanDriver in the file /etc/neutron/vpn_agent.ini
   vpn_device_driver=neutron.services.vpn.device_drivers \
       .strongswan_ipsec.StrongSwanDriver
c, Apparmor can interfere with both creation of tunnels and
   established tunnels, because it controls access to operating
   system resources. Thus we can use below commands to remove
   apparmor definitions from the kernel.
     sudo apparmor_parser -R usr.lib.ipsec.charon
     sudo apparmor_parser -R usr.lib.ipsec.stroke
   However, what we are seeing is that even though we disable the
   profile for charon and stroke, apparmor is re-enabling them
   (at unknown times). As a result, we can directly disable them
   by the following commands:
     sudo ln -s /etc/apparmor.d/usr.lib.ipsec.charon \
         /etc/apparmor.d/disable/
     sudo ln -s /etc/apparmor.d/usr.lib.ipsec.stroke \
         /etc/apparmor.d/disable/
     sudo service apparmor restart
   In a word, you need to take care of your apparmor configurations.
d, Supports Ubuntu only. A separate commit will address Fedora.
e, Other steps are the same with the existing openSwan driver.

This patch is based on patchset67 of nachi's initial vpnaas
implementation, many thanks to nachi.

"}, {'number': 64, 'created': '2015-03-14 00:22:46.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/template/strongswan/ipsec.conf.template', 'neutron_vpnaas/tests/unit/services/vpn/device_drivers/test_ipsec.py', 'etc/vpn_agent.ini', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/strongswan_ipsec.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/common/netns_wrapper.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/template/strongswan/ipsec.secret.template', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/template/strongswan/strongswan.conf.template', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/ipsec.py', 'etc/neutron/rootwrap.d/vpnaas.filters'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/6d55e377ea5d0f97aef59e6d64c3dc0ca630af26', 'message': "IPsec strongSwan driver implemention

This patch implements strongSwan driver for VPNaaS, Initial effort
only supports strongSwan >= 5.x and implements an equivalent psk
net-to-net vpn service as openSwan driver did based on recommended
configuration.

Implements blueprint ipsec-strongswan-driver

DocImpact
a, StrongSwan and openSwan cannot be installed at the same time.
   Thus, both cannot be enabled for use. In the future when
   flavors/STF support is available, this will still constrain
   the flavors which can be used together.
b, Adding StrongswanDriver in the file /etc/neutron/vpn_agent.ini
   vpn_device_driver=neutron.services.vpn.device_drivers \
       .strongswan_ipsec.StrongSwanDriver
c, Apparmor can interfere with both creation of tunnels and
   established tunnels, because it controls access to operating
   system resources. Thus we can use below commands to remove
   apparmor definitions from the kernel.
     sudo apparmor_parser -R usr.lib.ipsec.charon
     sudo apparmor_parser -R usr.lib.ipsec.stroke
   However, what we are seeing is that even though we disable the
   profile for charon and stroke, apparmor is re-enabling them
   (at unknown times). As a result, we can directly disable them
   by the following commands:
     sudo ln -s /etc/apparmor.d/usr.lib.ipsec.charon \
         /etc/apparmor.d/disable/
     sudo ln -s /etc/apparmor.d/usr.lib.ipsec.stroke \
         /etc/apparmor.d/disable/
     sudo service apparmor restart
   In a word, you need to take care of your apparmor configurations.
d, Supports Ubuntu only. A separate commit will address Fedora.
e, Other steps are the same with the existing openSwan driver.

This patch is based on patchset67 of nachi's initial vpnaas
implementation, many thanks to nachi.

Change-Id: Ia3eb10a9103bdceb2a29f2372b410b946f3a89cc
"}]
commit_message:
IPsec strongSwan driver implemention

This patch implements strongSwan driver for VPNaaS, Initial effort
only supports strongSwan >= 5.x and implements an equivalent psk
net-to-net vpn service as openSwan driver did based on recommended
configuration.

Implements blueprint ipsec-strongswan-driver

DocImpact
a, StrongSwan and openSwan cannot be installed at the same time.
   Thus, both cannot be enabled for use. In the future when
   flavors/STF support is available, this will still constrain
   the flavors which can be used together.
b, Adding StrongswanDriver in the file /etc/neutron/vpn_agent.ini
   vpn_device_driver=neutron.services.vpn.device_drivers \
       .strongswan_ipsec.StrongSwanDriver
c, Apparmor can interfere with both creation of tunnels and
   established tunnels, because it controls access to operating
   system resources. Thus we can use below commands to remove
   apparmor definitions from the kernel.
     sudo apparmor_parser -R usr.lib.ipsec.charon
     sudo apparmor_parser -R usr.lib.ipsec.stroke
   However, what we are seeing is that even though we disable the
   profile for charon and stroke, apparmor is re-enabling them
   (at unknown times). As a result, we can directly disable them
   by the following commands:
     sudo ln -s /etc/apparmor.d/usr.lib.ipsec.charon \
         /etc/apparmor.d/disable/
     sudo ln -s /etc/apparmor.d/usr.lib.ipsec.stroke \
         /etc/apparmor.d/disable/
     sudo service apparmor restart
   In a word, you need to take care of your apparmor configurations.
d, Supports Ubuntu only. A separate commit will address Fedora.
e, Other steps are the same with the existing openSwan driver.

This patch is based on patchset67 of nachi's initial vpnaas
implementation, many thanks to nachi.

Change-Id: Ia3eb10a9103bdceb2a29f2372b410b946f3a89cc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas refs/changes/91/144391/51 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return config_file_name if not status_output: return

commit_message:
[IBP] fix apt pinning

It was erroneosly set to ubuntu release name such as precise or
trusty.
It should use single 'Pin:' statement within pinning stanza.
So, all provided repo options will be combined into single line
'release' statement and finally it will look like this:

  Package: *
  Pin: release n=trusty,c=main,c=restricted,c=universe,c=multiverse
  Pin-Priority: 1001

Partially implements: blueprint ibp-build-ubuntu-images

Change-Id: Idd24b8e2c0f108bbe25e8c919b6c520bea4aa525

commit_message:
Implement deployment-create

The deployment-create command creates a derived config
from the supplied config, then creates a deployment with
that. Supported signal transports are TEMP_URL_SIGNAL and
NO_SIGNAL (CFN_SIGNAL and HEAT_SIGNAL are not possible as
they require the deployment to be associated with a stack resource).

The transport TEMP_URL_SIGNAL requires that a swift object
(with TempURL) be created to receive the signal, so heatclient
now depends on swiftclient so that this object can be created.

This change implements the heatclient portion of
blueprint software-config-trigger.

Implements-Blueprint: software-config-trigger

Change-Id: I6d73ba1f0cb9abc3331b5c3d3c788678ad88ff20
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/40/160240/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heatclient.common import deployment_utils@utils.arg('-i', '--input-value', metavar='<KEY=VALUE>', help=_('Input value to set on the deployment. ' 'This can be specified multiple times.'), action='append') @utils.arg('-a', '--action', metavar='<ACTION>', default='UPDATE', help=_('Name of action for this deployment. ' 'Can be a custom action, or one of: ' 'CREATE, UPDATE, DELETE, SUSPEND, RESUME')) @utils.arg('-c', '--config', metavar='<CONFIG>', help=_('ID of the configuration to deploy.')) @utils.arg('-s', '--server', metavar='<SERVER>', help=_('ID of the server being deployed to.')) @utils.arg('-t', '--signal-transport', default='TEMP_URL_SIGNAL', metavar='<TRANSPORT>', help=_('How the server should signal to heat with the deployment ' 'output values. TEMP_URL_SIGNAL will create a ' 'Swift TempURL to be signaled via HTTP PUT. NO_SIGNAL will ' 'result in the resource going to the COMPLETE state ' 'without waiting for any signal.')) @utils.arg('--container', metavar='<CONTAINER_NAME>', help=_('Optional name of container to store TEMP_URL_SIGNAL ' 'objects in. If not specified a container will be created ' 'with a name derived from the DEPLOY_NAME')) @utils.arg('--timeout', metavar='<TIMEOUT>', type=int, default=60, help=_('Deployment timeout in minutes.')) @utils.arg('name', metavar='<DEPLOY_NAME>', help=_('Name of the derived config associated with this ' 'deployment. This is used to apply a sort order to the ' 'list of configurations currently deployed to the server.')) def do_deployment_create(hc, args): try: config = hc.software_configs.get(config_id=args.config) except exc.HTTPNotFound: raise exc.CommandError(_('Configuration not found: %s') % args.id) derrived_params = deployment_utils.build_derived_config_params( action=args.action, source=config, name=args.name, input_values=utils.format_parameters(args.input_value, False), server_id=args.server, signal_transport=args.signal_transport, signal_id=deployment_utils.build_signal_id(hc, args) ) derived_config = hc.software_configs.create(**derrived_params) sd = hc.software_deployments.create( tenant_id='asdf', config_id=derived_config.id, server_id=args.server, action=args.action, status='IN_PROGRESS' ) print(jsonutils.dumps(sd.to_dict(), indent=2)) raise exc.CommandError(_('Deployment not found: %s') % args.id)
deleted_lines: raise exc.CommandError('Deployment not found: %s' % args.id)

commit_message:
Disable password autocomplete in the login form

This fix adds autocomplete=off attribute
to password input in the login form when
it turned to type=text for password revealing.
Without this attr user can use autocomplete
to access someone others password through
clicking on 'show password' icon and
double-clicking in password field after that.

Change-Id: Id9ac3510fff81d89046c5d00f8d72963ea8127ad
Closes-Bug: #1403815
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/44/142844/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $input.attr('autocomplete', 'off');

commit_message:
Set use_syslog in murano.

use_syslog is used but not set. So as by default its value is false
syslog is never used and we don't see murano logs into the Fuel UI.

Closes-bug: #1431878
Change-Id: I0176842a4398776d4bb204e9260b75584c72e79c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/51/164151/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $use_syslog = hiera('use_syslog', false)

commit_message:
Add 'testr' command via 'pretty_tox' in tox

Adding the execution of unit tests when running `tox -v -epy27` in
gates. It was deactivated before. `pretty_tox` script is copied from
current master neutron. `pretty_tox` uses `subunit-trace` which is part
of the `tempest_lib` dependency. This dependency it allow us to open the
door to future functional tests in the plugin.

Change-Id: I066131060ec37dd5513f1ca5b2493517ea92ea8b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/84/164984/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #! /bin/sh TESTRARGS=$1 exec 3>&1 status=$(exec 4>&1 >&3; ( python setup.py testr --slowest --testr-args="--subunit $TESTRARGS"; echo $? >&4 ) | subunit-trace -f) && exit $status

added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2015-03-16 19:37+0000\n" "PO-Revision-Date: 2015-03-16 15:02+0000\n"msgstr "调解<systemitem class=\"service\">nova-compute</systemitem> 服务和数据库之间的互动。它消除了由<systemitem class=\"service\">nova-compute</systemitem>直接访问云数据库， <systemitem class=\"service\">nova-conductor</systemitem>可横向的扩展，请不要将它部署到运行<systemitem class=\"service\">nova-compute</systemitem>服务所在的节点，更多信息，请参考<link href=\"http://russellbryantnet.wordpress.com/2012/11/19/a-new-nova-service-nova/conductor/\">一个全新的Nova服务：nova-conductor</link>。"msgstr "<systemitem class=\"service\">nova-cert</systemitem> 模块"msgstr "一个服务器的守护进程，为X509证书服务的Nova Cert 服务，用于为<placeholder-1/>生成证书，仅用于EC2 API。"msgstr "虚拟机网络"msgstr "<systemitem class=\"service\">nova-network</systemitem> 守护进程"msgstr "和 <systemitem class=\"service\">nova-compute</systemitem>服务类似，从队列接收网络任务然后操作网络，执行的任务诸如设置网桥或更改IPtables规则。"msgstr "终端接口"msgstr "<systemitem class=\"service\">nova-consoleauth</systemitem> 守护进程"msgstr "授权令牌是给终端代理提供用户所使用的。参考 <systemitem class=\"service\">nova-novncproxy</systemitem> 和 <systemitem class=\"service\">nova-xvpnvcproxy</systemitem>，此服务须运行在终端代理方可工作。用户可以运行任意类型的代理，在一个集群配置中运行单一的 <systemitem class=\"service\">nova-consoleauth</systemitem>服务。更多信息请参考 <link href=\"http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/about-nova-consoleauth.html\">About nova-consoleauth</link>。"msgstr "<systemitem class=\"service\">nova-novncproxy</systemitem> 守护进程"msgstr "提供一个代理，用于访问正在运行的实例，通过VNC协议，支持基于浏览器的novnc客户端。"msgstr "<systemitem class=\"service\">nova-spicehtml5proxy</systemitem> 守护进程"msgstr "提供一个代理，用于访问正在运行的实例，通过 SPICE 协议，支持基于浏览器的 HTML5 客户端。"msgstr "<systemitem class=\"service\">nova-xvpnvncproxy</systemitem> 守护进程"msgstr "提供一个代理，用于访问正在运行的实例，通过VNC协议，支持OpenStack特定的Java客户端。"msgstr "<systemitem class=\"service\">nova-cert</systemitem> 守护进程"msgstr "X509 证书。"msgstr "在Debian中，一个独特的包<package>nova-consoleproxy</package> ，提供了包含<package>nova-novncproxy</package>, <package>nova-spicehtml5proxy</package>, and <package>nova-xvpvncproxy</package>三个包，欲选择相应的包，编辑文件<filename>/etc/default/nova-consoleproxy</filename>或者使用<package>debconf</package>接口。用户也可以手动编辑文件<filename>/etc/default/nova-consoleproxy</filename> ，以及启动和停止终端守护进程。"msgstr "镜像管理(EC2 场景)"msgstr "<systemitem class=\"service\">nova-objectstore</systemitem> 守护进程"msgstr "一个S3接口，用于注册镜像，使用的是OpenStack 镜像服务，这个是由euca2ools来支持的，euca2ools使用 <emphasis role=\"italic\">S3 语言</emphasis>来和<systemitem class=\"service\">nova-objectstore</systemitem>通话，然后， <systemitem class=\"service\">nova-objectstore</systemitem>将之翻译向镜像服务发出请求。"msgstr "euca2ools 客户端"msgstr "一组交互式的命令行工具，用于管理云的资源，尽管其并非OpenStack的模块，用户可以配置<systemitem class=\"service\">nova-api</systemitem> 以支持EC2接口。更多信息，请参考<link href=\"https://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/3.4/index.html\">Eucalyptus 3.4 文档</link>"msgstr "命令行客户端和其他接口"msgstr "nova 客户端"msgstr "用于用户作为租户管理员或最终用户来提交命令。"msgstr "其他组件"msgstr "队列"msgstr "在守护进程之间的一个中心化的枢纽，用来传送消息。通常由<link href=\"http://www.rabbitmq.com/\">RabbitMQ</link>来实现，但是也可以是其他支持AMQP消息队列协议的软件实现，如 <link href=\"http://qpid.apache.org/\">Apache Qpid</link> 或 <link href=\"http://www.zeromq.org/\">Zero MQ</link>。"msgstr "存储构建时和运行时的状态，为云基础设施，包括有："msgstr "可用实例类型"msgstr "使用中的实例"msgstr "理论上，OpenStack计算可以支持任何和SQL-Alchemy所支持的后端数据库，通常使用SQLite3来做测试可开发工作，MySQL和PostgreSQL 作生产环境。"msgstr "将LDAP当作后端认证的集成"msgstr "存储概念"msgstr "OpenStack堆栈使用下列存储类型："msgstr "On-instance / ephemeral"msgstr "运行在操作系统中，且提供scratch空间"msgstr "用于给虚拟机(VM)添加额外的持久存储"msgstr "用于存放虚拟机镜像和数据"msgstr "随着VM的销毁而消失"msgstr "除非人工删除，否则一直存在"msgstr "访问和VM想关联"msgstr "对任何地方都可用"msgstr "在OpenStack计算服务下实现的文件系统"msgstr "通过OpenStack块存储控制协议(例如，iSCSI)来挂载"msgstr "REST API"msgstr "系统管理员配置大小，基于flavor"msgstr "大小根据需要而定"msgstr "针对于未来的增长，可轻松扩展"msgstr "举例：10GB 第一块磁盘，30GB 第二块磁盘"msgstr "举例：1TB “扩展硬盘”"msgstr "举例：10倍的TB数据单元存储"msgstr "用户须知：<placeholder-1/>"msgstr "swift 客户端"msgstr "添加安全组和规则"

commit_message:
enforce domain:update/delete policy for floating_ip_dns v2.1 REST API layer.

domain:update/delete should require admin.

This patch enforces domain:update/delete policy for floating_ip_dns v2.1
REST API layer and updates the testcase.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy

Change-Id: I3bd8c678e4966a80bfb6925e23d7d4e6007ccedb

added_lines: class FloatingIPDNSEntryPolicyEnforcementV21(test.NoDBTestCase): def setUp(self): super(FloatingIPDNSEntryPolicyEnforcementV21, self).setUp() self.controller = fipdns_v21.FloatingIPDNSEntryController() self.req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('') def _common_policy_check(self, func, *arg, **kwarg): rule_name = "compute_extension:v3:os-floating-ip-dns" rule = {rule_name: "project:non_fake"} self.policy.set_rules(rule) exc = self.assertRaises( exception.PolicyNotAuthorized, func, *arg, **kwarg) self.assertEqual( "Policy doesn't allow %s to be performed." % rule_name, exc.format_message()) def test_show_ip_policy_failed(self): self._common_policy_check(self.controller.show, self.req, _quote_domain(domain), test_ipv4_address) def test_delete_policy_failed(self): self._common_policy_check(self.controller.delete, self.req, _quote_domain(domain), name) def test_update_policy_failed(self): body = {'dns_entry': {'ip': test_ipv4_address, 'dns_type': 'A'}} self._common_policy_check(self.controller.update, self.req, _quote_domain(domain), name, body=body) class FloatingIPDNSDomainPolicyEnforcementV21(test.NoDBTestCase): def setUp(self): super(FloatingIPDNSDomainPolicyEnforcementV21, self).setUp() self.controller = fipdns_v21.FloatingIPDNSDomainController() self.req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('') def _common_policy_check(self, rule, rule_name, func, *arg, **kwarg): self.policy.set_rules(rule) exc = self.assertRaises( exception.PolicyNotAuthorized, func, *arg, **kwarg) self.assertEqual( "Policy doesn't allow %s to be performed." % rule_name, exc.format_message()) def test_index_ip_policy_failed(self): rule_name = "compute_extension:v3:os-floating-ip-dns" rule = {rule_name: "project:non_fake"} self._common_policy_check( rule, rule_name, self.controller.index, self.req) def test_delete_policy_failed(self): rule_name = "compute_extension:v3:os-floating-ip-dns:domain:delete" rule = {rule_name: "project:non_fake"} self._common_policy_check( rule, rule_name, self.controller.delete, self.req, _quote_domain(domain)) def test_update_policy_failed(self): rule_name = "compute_extension:v3:os-floating-ip-dns:domain:update" rule = {rule_name: "project:non_fake"} body = {'domain_entry': {'scope': 'private', 'project': 'testproject'}} self._common_policy_check( rule, rule_name, self.controller.update, self.req, _quote_domain(domain), body=body)

commit_message:
Record finishe time of instance_action

This patch adds objects.InstanceAction.action_finish to __exit__
of EventReporter, so after each instance action event exit, it will
update the finish time of the rlated instance action.

Closes-Bug 1428539
Change-Id: I3fd2c86dda824e24d11b39dcb6283cee5eaaccc4

commit_message:
Adding support for ddt

According to agreement with Marc and Mathew
we are going to use ddt lib
https://github.com/txels/ddt
There are set of primitives for data-driven test development
This commit is a prerequisite for modification
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/153234/

Change-Id: I869841fde1f0ba70728d738ff34ca52fb351d072

commit_message:
Revert "fix check_ports_exist_on_l3agent in no subnet case"

This reverts commit e99f6e00cfd397bb74d44c9462dfcfa545dbed8c.

This patch introduces an issue with the Tempest test. Already there was a similar patch that broke the tempest test for DVR.
This patch consistently failed to pass  test_add_list_remove_router_on_l3_agent.
I would recommend to revert this patch until the tempest test is fixed.

Change-Id: Ibd1fcb7f5f3196ebc1ffa01b8d5d7c6e8f1aaaac

commit_message:
Prevent updating mac address of bound port

Currently, a port's mac address can be updated even if it is bound.
This fixes the _check_mac_update_allowed() call to pass just port update
attributes rather than the entire payload and fills in missing testing.

Change-Id: Iee8492e9b4fcdb07eb438eb6f5958d7addeb3d8f
Closes-bug: #1429672

commit_message:
Enable downgrade migrations in unit tests

Our downgrade migrations were not tested. Enable it.

Change-Id: I3b330f99adb4054701d218d7e9a671b46741809d
Closes-Bug: #1431823

commit_message:
Use oslo.log for heat_integrationtests

Later the integration jobs can be tuned to have their own
logging settings.

This change also raises _log_console_output to info, so it is displayed
by default.

Change-Id: Ifcaa6faf76c655e0c8cfd7d76775b80de70062c4

commit_message:
HDP plugin: Fix Beeswax error when starting Hue

Starting Hue sometimes fails because Beeswax does not find Java home.
This patch explicitely sets JAVA_HOME in Hadoop conf so this kind of
error does not happen.

Change-Id: Ic7ede045cdb660006a0b52a5e5dd25c996a0c1b7
Closes-Bug: #1429905
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/68/162668/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cmd = 'export JAVA_HOME={0} '.format(java_home)
deleted_lines: cmd = 'JAVA_HOME={0} '.format(java_home)

commit_message:
Replace kubecfg with kubectl

Kubecfg is deprecated and it doesn't work on
images with latest k8s

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-15 10:06:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/269344bba30aad4d8b2b46ed2425d9eb7cb603b8', 'message': 'hypervisor list and details page reports invalid data

Nova some times allows to have same hypervisor_hostname for
more than one hypervisor. In this scenario, horizon hypervisor
Table view and Detail view shows invalid data as follows:

Table View:
For those hypervisors having same hypervisor_hostname, Table
view reports the same values for all of them, irrespective
of actual values

Detail View:
For those hypervisors having same hypervisor_hostname, Details
view reports the instance from all them , instead of for the
given hypervisor.

given hypervisor.

By using the combination of hypervisor id and name, hypervisor
detail veiw is updated to filter the instances from the given
hypervisor id.

Change-Id: I45925ac70f1a6b123c83888373bddb108380a9c0
Closes-bug: #1402572
'}]
commit_message:
hypervisor list and details page reports invalid data

Nova some times allows to have same hypervisor_hostname for
more than one hypervisor. In this scenario, horizon hypervisor
Table view and Detail view shows invalid data as follows:

Table View:
For those hypervisors having same hypervisor_hostname, Table
view reports the same values for all of them, irrespective
of actual values

Detail View:
For those hypervisors having same hypervisor_hostname, Details
view reports the instance from all them , instead of for the
given hypervisor.

By using the combination of hypervisor id and name, hypervisor
detail veiw is updated to filter the instances from the given
hypervisor id.

Change-Id: I45925ac70f1a6b123c83888373bddb108380a9c0
Closes-bug: #1402572
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/59/141759/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return "%s_%s" % (hypervisor.id, hypervisor.hypervisor_hostname)
deleted_lines: return hypervisor.hypervisor_hostname

If an unprivileged user, either " "intentionally or accidently modifies or deletes any of the parameters or the" " file itself then it would cause severe availability issue causing denial of" " service to the other end users. Thus user and group ownership of such " "critical configuration files must be set to that component owner." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_identity-checklist.xml20(para) #: ./security-guide/section_identity-checklist.xml46(para) msgid "Run the following commands:" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_identity-checklist.xml28(para) msgid "" "<emphasis role=\"bold\">Pass:</emphasis> If user and group ownership of all " "these config files is set to keystone. An attacker" " may try to eavesdrop on the channel in order to get access to sensitive " "information. Thus all the components must communicate with each other using " "a secured communication protocol like HTTPS." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_identity-checklist.xml72(para) msgid "" "<emphasis role=\"bold\">Pass:</emphasis> If value of parameter " "<placeholder-1/> under <literal>[ssl]</literal> section in " "<filename>/etc/keystone/keystone.conf</filename> is set to " "<literal>True</literal>." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_identity-checklist.xml77(para) msgid "" "<emphasis role=\"bold\">Fail:</emphasis> If value of parameter " "<placeholder-1/> under <literal>[ssl]</literal> section is not set to " "<literal>True</literal>." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_identity-checklist.xml80(para) msgid "Recommended in: <xref linkend=\"secure_communication\"/>" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_identity-checklist.xml84(title) msgid "" "Check-Identity-04: Does Identity use strong hashing algorithms for PKI " "tokens?" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_identity-checklist.xml86(para) msgid "" "MD5 is a weak and depreciated hashing algorithm. It can be cracked using " "bruteforce attack. Identity tokens are sensitive and need to be protected " "with a stronger hashing algorithm to prevent unauthorized disclosure and " "subsequent access." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_identity-checklist.xml91(para) msgid "" "<emphasis role=\"bold\">Pass:</emphasis> If value of parameter " "<placeholder-1/> under <literal>[token]</literal> section in " "<filename>/etc/keystone/keystone.conf</filename> is set to SHA256." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_identity-checklist.xml96(para) msgid "" "<emphasis role=\"bold\">Fail:</emphasis> If value of parameter " "<placeholder-1/> under <literal>[token]</literal>section is set to MD5." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_identity-checklist.xml99(para) msgid "Recommended in: <xref linkend=\"identity-tokens\"/>" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_identity-checklist.xml103(title) msgid "" "Check-Identity-05: Is value of parameter <placeholder-1/> set to default " "(114688)?" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_identity-checklist.xml106(para) msgid "" "The parameter <placeholder-1/> defines the maximum body size per request in " "bytes. If the maximum size is not defined, the attacker could craft an " "arbitary request of large size causing the service to crash and finally " "resulting in Denial Of Service attack. Assigning the maximum value ensures " "that any malicious oversized request gets blocked ensuring continued " "availability of the component." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_identity-checklist.xml115(para) msgid "" "<emphasis role=\"bold\">Pass:</emphasis> If value of parameter " "<placeholder-1/> in <filename>/etc/keystone/keystone.conf</filename> is set " "to default (114688) or some reasonable value based on your environment." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_identity-checklist.xml120(para) msgid "" "<emphasis role=\"bold\">Fail:</emphasis> If value of parameter " "<placeholder-1/> is not set." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_identity-checklist.xml125(title) msgid "" "Check-Identity-06: is admin token disabled in " "<filename>/etc/keystone/keystone.conf</filename>?" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_identity-checklist.xml127(para) msgid "" "Admin token is generally used to bootstrap Identity. commit_message:
Redirect initial hit to login page

By rendering the login page within the GET / path we cannot trap the /auth
location from horizon to allow us to setup kerberos and other REMOTE_USER tasks
on that path.

On initial unauthenticated request redirect the user to /auth/login.

Change-Id: Ibe577672fc67a33460ea5d8726925b7e4b2a65e9
Closes-Bug: #1418440

commit_message:
Source gnocchi alarms resources in the right way

Previously we missed typo in resource mapping name. It happend due to
using hardcoded name in registring new resource in environment.
Other resources in contrib use alternative approach, i.e. they register
classes using mapping function from native module.

This patch adds same approach for Gnocchi alarms. Also small refactoring
for re-using existing code in test.

Change-Id: Ibe8dfc54f9502fb6e97e496fb51b4e46e7f4d8a9
Related-Bug: #1431873

commit_message:
heat.conf options for transport properties default

This change adds config options so that operators can choose the default
transports for server software_config_transport and deployment
signal_transport. With properly set config values, templates should
have no need for setting these options at all, making templates more
portable across clouds.

The defaults currently are the cfn transports but consideration could be
made in the future to switch to swift.

Downstream deployment tools (puppet etc) would have enough information
to set the best heat.conf values, with something like the following
logic:

- if there is an object-store endpoint, set for *TEMP_URL*
- if there is no cloudformation endpoint, set for *HEAT*
- else set for *CFN*

Change-Id: I5f3d41db35e380486051cee432a7190b3c51fa00
Related-Blueprint: software-config-swift-signal

commit_message:
storage: add measure query class

This class is going to be used to create a callable that can be used to
find measures in metrics matching some values.

Change-Id: I7970d4e8177f46c1af93f6b0b3276fddf669e54a

added_lines: from oslotest import baseclass TestMeasureQuery(base.BaseTestCase): def test_equal(self): q = storage.MeasureQuery({"=": 4}) self.assertTrue(q(4)) self.assertFalse(q(40)) def test_gt(self): q = storage.MeasureQuery({">": 4}) self.assertTrue(q(40)) self.assertFalse(q(4)) def test_and(self): q = storage.MeasureQuery({"and": [{">": 4}, {"<": 10}]}) self.assertTrue(q(5)) self.assertFalse(q(40)) self.assertFalse(q(1)) def test_or(self): q = storage.MeasureQuery({"or": [{"=": 4}, {"=": 10}]}) self.assertTrue(q(4)) self.assertTrue(q(10)) self.assertFalse(q(-1)) def test_modulo(self): q = storage.MeasureQuery({"=": [{"%": 5}, 0]}) self.assertTrue(q(5)) self.assertTrue(q(10)) self.assertFalse(q(-1)) self.assertFalse(q(6)) def test_math(self): q = storage.MeasureQuery( { "and": [ # v+5 is bigger 0 {"≥": [{"+": 5}, 0]}, # v-6 is not 5 {"≠": [5, {"-": 6}]}, ], } ) self.assertTrue(q(5)) self.assertTrue(q(10)) self.assertFalse(q(11)) def test_empty(self): q = storage.MeasureQuery({}) self.assertFalse(q(5)) self.assertFalse(q(10)) def test_bad_format(self): self.assertRaises(storage.InvalidQuery, storage.MeasureQuery, {"foo": [{"=": 4}, {"=": 10}]}) self.assertRaises(storage.InvalidQuery, storage.MeasureQuery, {"=": [1, 2, 3]})

commit_message:
Websocket Proxy should verify Origin header

If the Origin HTTP header passed in the WebSocket handshake does
not match the host, this could indicate an attempt at a
cross-site attack.  This commit adds a check to verify
the origin matches the host.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Ica6ec23d6f69a236657d5ba0c3f51b693c633649
Closes-Bug: 1409142

commit_message:
Remove 'holland' package from the wheel repository

The holland package is unused in any of the plays and appears to have
mistakenly been added back to the wheel repository in
8e6dbd01c9924ebecffdc04f74e4f6d042610ed8.

This patch removes it again.

Change-Id: I68f9c286c90e613ed1edff5e73ea65a2cd4064ed
Closes-Bug: #1425935
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/22/164822/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
labs: fix color output in osbash.sh

The last line of osbash does not output color because the "-e" flag is
missing in the echo statement. This patch supplies the missing flag and
wraps the line at 80 characters.

Change-Id: I38856d6a14d7764a4b8b01f7fdc79ee1d8884f72
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/92/164492/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo -e >&2 "${CStatus:-}osbash completed in $(($ENDTIME - $STARTTIME))" \ "seconds.${CReset:-}"
deleted_lines: echo "${CStatus:-}osbash completed in $(($ENDTIME - $STARTTIME)) seconds.${CReset:-}"

subject: Nova boot will fail if the host doesn't have libvirt installed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-16 19:52:04.000000000', 'files': ['docker/nova-compute/nova-libvirt/start.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/08bd99a50fcc48539e69ff65334f8e22c4d25f6f', 'message': "Nova boot will fail if the host doesn't have libvirt installed

Libvirt contains a package that sets the permissions of KVM.
If the host does not have libvirt installed the permissions
will never be set and nova boot will fail.

Change-Id: Ie5509199391db55e0984d59a6623f021f3ae46c1
"}]
commit_message:
Nova boot will fail if the host doesn't have libvirt installed

Libvirt contains a package that sets the permissions of KVM.
If the host does not have libvirt installed the permissions
will never be set and nova boot will fail.

Change-Id: Ie5509199391db55e0984d59a6623f021f3ae46c1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/44/164844/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If libvirt is not installed on the host permissions need to be set chmod 660 /dev/kvm chown root:kvm /dev/kvm

subject: Force LANGUAGE=en_US in test runs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-13 15:44:20.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/bf6d966756d3745d2facd5ac39444646dcfae6de', 'message': 'Force LANGUAGE=en_US in test runs

Basically back-porting what was done for Nova in this patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/160892/

If your native locale is not en_US and you run tests, some could fail
due to the message translation that happens since the assertion messages
are in en_US (not translated, just hard-coded in the tests).

Note that setting LANG=en_US had no effect.

Change-Id: I16fab554612a718871625f688dd5501a69fb3417
'}]
commit_message:
Force LANGUAGE=en_US in test runs

Basically back-porting what was done for Nova in this patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/160892/

If your native locale is not en_US and you run tests, some could fail
due to the message translation that happens since the assertion messages
are in en_US (not translated, just hard-coded in the tests).

Note that setting LANG=en_US had no effect.

Change-Id: I16fab554612a718871625f688dd5501a69fb3417
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/26/164226/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LANGUAGE=en_US LANGUAGE=en_US LANGUAGE=en_US

commit_message:
Fixed archiving of deleted records

Added specific column order for insert clause
in insert from select query, used in archivation.
Changed source for tables metadata from db to models.

Change-Id: Idff93ab4fa3397746999a836de54354235919471
Closes-Bug: #1431571

commit_message:
Add get_api_session to db api

In order to query to api database we'll need to be able to get a session
object with the proper configuration.  This adds a helper method to do
that.

Change-Id: I6b47b24788960c1772ddad799867690533f7900a
Partially-Implements: bp cells-v2-mapping
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/66/161866/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_api_session(use_slave=False): connection_url = CONF.api_database.connection facade = _create_facade_lazily(connection_url=connection_url) return facade.get_session(use_slave=use_slave)

subject: Use the proper database engine for nova-manage
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-05 18:44:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d0313b78b1265b0bef9d9182c2086a5e571a22ff', 'message': "Use the proper database configuration for nova-manage

Nova-manage recently gained the ability to manage both an 'api' and the
'main' database.  It assumes that CONF.database.connection will be set
to the correct database that should be managed.  This has the potential
for confusion and error so it is being updated to use
CONF.api_database.connection for db commands that should affect the new
'api' database.

DocImpact
bp: cells-v2-mapping

Change-Id: I8707baf66e329a274ed5e53aba8d25286c30603b

Nova-manage recently gained the ability to manage both an 'api' and the
'main' database.  It initially used get_engine() to get a sqlalchemy
engine which had no assurance of being configured for the correct
database.  There is now a get_api_engine() method so it should use that
for 'nova-manage api_db' commands.

This means that it those commands will operate on the database
configured under CONF.api_database.connection

commit_message:
Use the proper database engine for nova-manage

Nova-manage recently gained the ability to manage both an 'api' and the
'main' database.  It initially used get_engine() to get a sqlalchemy
engine which had no assurance of being configured for the correct
database.  There is now a get_api_engine() method so it should use that
for 'nova-manage api_db' commands.

This means that it those commands will operate on the database
configured under CONF.api_database.connection

DocImpact
Partially-Implements: bp cells-v2-mapping

Change-Id: I8707baf66e329a274ed5e53aba8d25286c30603b
