subject: Use global_filter to avoid scan of missing devs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-17 03:32:25.000000000', 'files': ['lib/cinder_backends/lvm'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/0c70ad4c520367e16762d4e161e5b96af9c28414', 'message': "Use global_filter to avoid scan of missing devs

A while back I added an lvm.conf file with a device filter setting
to try and clean up the LVM hangs in the gate:
  (commit 0b9e76f280208b5b5ad54bb6fbc4133e63037286)

It turns out this was only part of the problem, the other problem
is that on an LVS/VGS command LVM will always poke at block devices
on the system to see if they belong to it.  There are a number of
situations in gate tests where /dev/sdX devices are created and
deleted and the result is that we hit situations where LVM tries
to open up devices to check them even if they've been removed.

This typically happens because udev hasn't updated yet, but the end
result is we have a blocking open call from LVM that takes approx
60 seconds to time out and fail.

The filter= only tells LVM to return devices from it's list that pass
the filter, but sadly it doesn't tell LVM that what it should or
shouldn't try to query via open calls. For that we need the global_filter.

This does in fact seem to eliminate our super long LVS/VGS command times
on several runs against my local setup.

This patch just adds an additional sed command to the cinder_backend lvm
setup script and makes the filter we already set global.

NOTE:
Another possible solution is to enable the lvmetad in our lvm.conf file.
This essentially tells LVM to store the device data when VG's or PV's are
added, this means we don't do the open at all which is likely a good
improvement that should be looked at.

There's some concern here though because it modifies the behavior of activate,
so I'd like to spend some time looking at that more closely and test things
out before considering using that instead of filters.

Change-Id: I6e202e01e627a161208b4c3745cfe5b8ef2ebe90
Closes-Bug: #1373513
"}]
commit_message:
Use global_filter to avoid scan of missing devs

A while back I added an lvm.conf file with a device filter setting
to try and clean up the LVM hangs in the gate:
  (commit 0b9e76f280208b5b5ad54bb6fbc4133e63037286)

It turns out this was only part of the problem, the other problem
is that on an LVS/VGS command LVM will always poke at block devices
on the system to see if they belong to it.  There are a number of
situations in gate tests where /dev/sdX devices are created and
deleted and the result is that we hit situations where LVM tries
to open up devices to check them even if they've been removed.

This typically happens because udev hasn't updated yet, but the end
result is we have a blocking open call from LVM that takes approx
60 seconds to time out and fail.

The filter= only tells LVM to return devices from it's list that pass
the filter, but sadly it doesn't tell LVM that what it should or
shouldn't try to query via open calls. For that we need the global_filter.

This does in fact seem to eliminate our super long LVS/VGS command times
on several runs against my local setup.

This patch just adds an additional sed command to the cinder_backend lvm
setup script and makes the filter we already set global.

NOTE:
Another possible solution is to enable the lvmetad in our lvm.conf file.
This essentially tells LVM to store the device data when VG's or PV's are
added, this means we don't do the open at all which is likely a good
improvement that should be looked at.

There's some concern here though because it modifies the behavior of activate,
so I'd like to spend some time looking at that more closely and test things
out before considering using that instead of filters.

Change-Id: I6e202e01e627a161208b4c3745cfe5b8ef2ebe90
Closes-Bug: #1373513
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/38/164938/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local global_filter="global_" sudo sed -i "/# global_filter = \[*\]/a\ $global_filter$filter_string" /etc/cinder/lvm.conf

commit_message:
libvirt: Fix live migration failure cleanup on ceph

_live_migration in the libvirt driver wasn't passing migrate_data to
the cleanup function, which caused its behaviour to be defaulted based
on the value of block_migration. These defaults are wrong for ceph,
meaning that the instance directory was not cleaned up.

This change ensures the libvirt driver always passes migrate_data to
the cleanup callback. It updates the tests to assert this, and also
that migrate data is passed to the post-success callback.

Closes-Bug: #1430223
Change-Id: I5d428b1c232ec245ff15d3ae54b442a25c1a96a5

provided request_data of a simple_cmc_request for the
certificate order API.

commit_message:
Source step - fix instance count limit and donut chart

In the current version of the Launch Instance Wizard Source Step,
the instance count field is not correctly limited based on current
instance usage and nova limits (maxTotalInstances). There is a bug
whereby the user can enter an instance count of more than what is
available (exceeding their quota). In addition, the donut chart
does not update properly when this occurs. This patch corrects this
so that if a user enters a number greater than what is available,
it automatically changes the count to the maximum count that will still
stay within quota limits.

Closes-Bug: 1432897

Change-Id: I24f1309b04f3c045c02b67409c49fc3ee86aea3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/12/164912/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: // initialize instance_count to 1 if ($scope.model.newInstanceSpec.instance_count <= 0) { $scope.model.newInstanceSpec.instance_count = 1; } var instance_count = $scope.model.newInstanceSpec.instance_count || 1; var remaining = Math.max(0, maxTotalInstances - totalInstancesUsed - selection.length * instance_count); // If a user has entered a count that will result in them exceeding their // quota, automatically decrease the count so that it stays within quota if (instance_count + totalInstancesUsed > maxTotalInstances) { $scope.model.newInstanceSpec.instance_count = maxTotalInstances - totalInstancesUsed; }
deleted_lines: if ($scope.model.newInstanceSpec.instance_count < 0) { $scope.model.newInstanceSpec.instance_count = 0; } else if ($scope.model.newInstanceSpec.instance_count > maxTotalInstances) { $scope.model.newInstanceSpec.instance_count = maxTotalInstances; } var instance_count= $scope.model.newInstanceSpec.instance_count || 0; remaining = Math.max(0, maxTotalInstances - totalInstancesUsed - selection.length * instance_count);

commit_message:
Just use the class name instead of TYPE constant

The TYPE constant is more of an internal protocol
detail and is not the best constant to use in exceptions
that tell the received data is invalid, instead just
prefer and use the class name instead which is more
relevant than the TYPE constant.

commit_message:
Ensure we register & deregister conductor listeners

Instead of just registering engine listeners that were
returned, make sure we also deregister them when the engine
has either finished or failed. This ensures that if a listener
has hold of any resources (or other) that it can clean those
up and be sure that its deregister call will be made.

Change-Id: Ia1420c435156362698702fed2bda11c2a0fef803
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/96/164096/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class _ListenerStack(object): """Listeners that are registered & deregistered on enter/exit TODO(harlowja): replace this with contextlib.ExitStack or equivalent in the future (that code is in python3.2+ and in a few backports that provide equivalent functionality). """ def __init__(self, listeners): self.listeners = listeners self._registered = [] def __enter__(self): leftover = self.listeners[len(self._registered):] for listener in leftover: listener.register() self._registered.append(listener) def __exit__(self, type, value, tb): while self._registered: listener = self._registered.pop() try: listener.deregister() except Exception: LOG.warn("Failed deregistering listener '%s'", listener, exc_info=True) def _listeners_from_job(self, job, engine): listeners = super(BlockingConductor, self)._listeners_from_job(job, engine) listeners.append(logging_listener.LoggingListener(engine, log=LOG)) return listeners listeners = self._listeners_from_job(job, engine) with _ListenerStack(listeners):
deleted_lines: with logging_listener.LoggingListener(engine, log=LOG):

advaned types.

commit_message:
Revise gate script library to report correctly

This patch implements fixes to the gate script library, and
corresponding fixes in the scripts that use it, in order to properly
report back at the end of the gate script run.

Change-Id: I45023a716ee2f849d8c9561a86ff48d6eac91e72
Closes-Bug: #1431422

commit_message:
Create a fixture for key repository

fixtures are the way to provide common setUp, using a mixin for this
is an antipattern.

Change-Id: I4516b783c96fce083abdd28fc24127ce27d7d57d

commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for network_delete_safe

This patches removes db layer hard-code permission checks for
network_delete_safe.

delete_network calls network_delete_safe, and the contex is elevated.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy

Change-Id: Ib6841dd52ba93ec2c6f717a5fc4a08348126ad95

commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for network_count_reserved_ips

This patches removes db layer hard-code permission checks for
network_count_reserved_ips.

network_count_reserved_ips is not called by any other code.
It is safe to remove the admin permission check.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy

Change-Id: I32529e27cdabc9ad5decb33768d7a19da1f404f6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/22/161622/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: VMware: Relocate volume to compliant datastore
revisions:

commit_message:
VMware: Relocate volume to compliant datastore

During attach to a nova instance, the backing VM
corresponding to the volume is relocated only if
the nova instance's ESX host cannot access the
backing's current datastore. The storage profile
is ignored and the volume's virtual disk might
end up in a non-compliant datastore. This patch
fixes the problem by checking storage profile
compliance of the current datastore.

Change-Id: I9f0ed6e179160a51e8c370087e9c903ed28e1728
Closes-Bug: #1301348
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/02/155702/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(VMDK_DRIVER, 'volumeops') @mock.patch.object(VMDK_DRIVER, 'ds_sel') def test_relocate_backing_nop(self, ds_sel, vops): volume = {'name': 'vol-1', 'size': 1} datastore = mock.sentinel.datastore vops.get_datastore.return_value = datastore profile = mock.sentinel.profile vops.get_profile.return_value = profile vops.is_datastore_accessible.return_value = True ds_sel.is_datastore_compliant.return_value = True backing = mock.sentinel.backing host = mock.sentinel.host self._driver._relocate_backing(volume, backing, host) vops.is_datastore_accessible.assert_called_once_with(datastore, host) ds_sel.is_datastore_compliant.assert_called_once_with(datastore, profile) self.assertFalse(vops.relocate_backing.called) @mock.patch.object(VMDK_DRIVER, 'volumeops') @mock.patch.object(VMDK_DRIVER, 'ds_sel') def test_relocate_backing_with_no_datastore( self, ds_sel, vops): volume = {'name': 'vol-1', 'size': 1} profile = mock.sentinel.profile vops.get_profile.return_value = profile vops.is_datastore_accessible.return_value = True ds_sel.is_datastore_compliant.return_value = False ds_sel.select_datastore.return_value = [] backing = mock.sentinel.backing host = mock.sentinel.host self.assertRaises(vmdk_exceptions.NoValidDatastoreException, self._driver._relocate_backing, volume, backing, host) ds_sel.select_datastore.assert_called_once_with( {hub.DatastoreSelector.SIZE_BYTES: volume['size'] * units.Gi, hub.DatastoreSelector.PROFILE_NAME: profile}, hosts=[host]) self.assertFalse(vops.relocate_backing.called) @mock.patch.object(VMDK_DRIVER, 'volumeops') @mock.patch.object(VMDK_DRIVER, '_get_volume_group_folder') @mock.patch.object(VMDK_DRIVER, 'ds_sel') def = True backing = mock.sentinel.backing host = mock.sentinel.host rp = mock.sentinel.rp datastore = mock.sentinel.datastore summary = mock.Mock(datastore=datastore) ds_sel.select_datastore.return_value = (host, rp, summary) folder = mock.sentinel.folder get_volume_group_folder.return_value = folder self._driver._relocate_backing(volume, backing, host) vops.relocate_backing.assert_called_once_with(backing, datastore, rp, host) vops.move_backing_to_folder.assert_called_once_with(backing, folder)

commit_message:
i18n Compatibility in VMAX driver

The patch fixed some message formatting issues according to the
i18n guidelines in the VMAX driver.

Change-Id: I5c1d2ec640d26c026bda89061e416fe7b136eaac

commit_message:
Versioned object - SoftwareDeployment

Prototype implementation of oslo.versionedobjects.
This patch adds SoftwareDeployment object.

Partially implements bp versioned-objects

Co-Authored-By: ShaoHe Feng <shaohe.feng@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>

Change-Id: I3666a8b2552d8c0c9dcf05efd9c423ff5252f77d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/29/152429/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2014 Intel Corp. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ SoftwareConfig object """ from heat.db import api as db_api from heat.objects import base from heat.objects import fields from heat.objects import software_config class SoftwareDeployment(base.HeatObject, base.HeatObjectDictCompat): fields = { 'id': fields.StringField(nullable=False), 'config_id': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'server_id': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'input_values': fields.JsonField(nullable=True), 'output_values': fields.JsonField(nullable=True), 'tenant': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'stack_user_project_id': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'action': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'status': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'status_reason': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'config': fields.ObjectField('SoftwareConfig'), 'created_at': fields.DateTimeField(read_only=True), 'updated_at': fields.DateTimeField(nullable=True), } @staticmethod def _from_db_object(context, deployment, db_deployment): for field in deployment.fields: if field == 'status_reason': deployment[field] = db_deployment['_status_reason'] elif field == 'config': deployment[field] = software_config.SoftwareConfig.get_by_id( context, db_deployment['config_id']) else: deployment[field] = db_deployment[field] deployment._context = context deployment.obj_reset_changes() return deployment @classmethod def create(cls, context, values): return cls._from_db_object( context, cls(), db_api.software_deployment_create(context, values)) @classmethod def get_by_id(cls, context, deployment_id): return cls._from_db_object( context, cls(), db_api.software_deployment_get(context, deployment_id)) @classmethod def get_all(cls, context, server_id=None): return [cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), db_deployment) for db_deployment in db_api.software_deployment_get_all( context, server_id)] @classmethod def update(cls, context, deployment_id, values): return cls._from_db_object( context, cls(), db_api.software_deployment_update(context, deployment_id, values)) @classmethod def delete(cls, context, deployment_id): db_api.software_deployment_delete(context, deployment_id)

commit_message:
Validate health_monitor id when associating to pool

Currently, Internal server error will be returned when associating
health monitor to pool with wrong monitor id. Fixes this by validating
health_monitor id when associating to pool.

Change-Id: If0e52397485ce4e8839db70f8c176a3ad115276d
Closes-bug: #1430606
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/80/163680/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # To make sure health_monitor exist. self._get_resource(context, HealthMonitor, monitor_id)

commit_message:
Add \n at the end of samples/local.conf

Currently if you `cat` the file, the bash prompt will be at a weird
position. And if you programmaticaly add a new line to this file,
the line will be, in fact, appended to the previous line.

Change-Id: I19ba018d9a934f8fdc07cc9bec50a0105f2710f9

commit_message:
when pxe option is not persisted, set pxe boot on next power on

if the server ipmi does not support the command 'chassis bootdev
pxe options=persistent' with 'persistent' option', the boot order
will not be stored for 2nd time, as a result server will hang,
because local hd has no boot loader for our pxe_ipmitool driver.

proposed changes to set pxe boot on next power on, if it is not
already persisted.

Change-Id: I65521d27a8c584179928ab22084915331e1f41aa
Closes-Bug: #1407820
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/68/151268/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _check_and_set_pxe_boot(task): # check if pxe boot is persistent on the device # if not, try setting next boot as pxe again. ipmimgmt = IPMIManagement() response = ipmimgmt.get_boot_device(task) LOG.debug("check if node is in persistent pxe boot") if response['boot_device'] == boot_devices.PXE and not response[ 'persistent']: LOG.debug("setting persistent pxe boot for node") ipmimgmt.set_boot_device(task, boot_devices.PXE, persistent=True) _check_and_set_pxe_boot(task) _check_and_set_pxe_boot(task)

subject: Remove use of contextlib.nested
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-24 15:34:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/3620dec8ed0bf15a94014af858e300459081a8c0', 'message': 'Remove use of contextlib.nested

The contextlib.nested call has been deprecated
in Python 2.7. This causes DeprecationWarning

There are also known issues with contextlib.nested
that were addressed by the native support for
multiple "with" variables. For instance, if the
first object is created but the second one throws

statements it is not a requirement.

commit_message:
Remove use of contextlib.nested

The contextlib.nested call has been deprecated
in Python 2.7. This causes DeprecationWarning
messages in the unit tests.

There are also known issues with contextlib.nested
that were addressed by the native support for
multiple "with" variables. For instance, if the
first object is created but the second one throws
an exception, the first object's __exit__ is never
called.

Since Cinder no longer supports 2.6 we can remove
the use of these contextlib.nested calls.

Added hacking check to catch if any new instances
are added to the codebase.

Note: line continuation markers (e.g. '\') had to
be used or syntax errors were thrown. While using
parentheses is the preferred way for multiple line
statements it is not a requirement.

Partial-Bug: 1428424
Change-Id: I7bb7d201d31ff239be3402fb64e5f202ede019b0

revisions:

While uploading an image, if you give a name which is less than 256
characters but more than 256 bytes, horizon gives a generic error
but glance gives meaningful error-> "Image name too long" but it

commit_message:
Fixes Error message during image upload due to long name

While uploading an image, if you give a name which is less than 256
characters but more than 256 bytes, horizon gives a generic error
but glance gives meaningful error-> "Image name too long" but it
doesn't propagate to the horizon. So, this patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I1bfe0056e3bc052e04b04db69a62251c1ac4cce7
Closes-bug: #1418061
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/27/152927/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif "Image name too long" in e.details: msg = _('Unable to create new image: Image name too long.')

Clean modal forms in Orchestration Stacks

commit_message:
Fix transfer tables example

The available.html.example file has some old markup.
This patch updates the markup. Additionally, the
row.disabled check in the transfer tables allocate
function is removed since it is not required.

Change-Id: Iedc29d7cdae723f767010e778ab5a1422d35098f
Closes-Bug: #1432241
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/94/164394/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Correct ngdoc in Neutron AngularJS service

The example objects documented for createNetwork and CreateSubnet
were incorrect.  Updated those.

Change-Id: I025f0ae13fe9b8f8d5923a8886e5330b9a580021
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/86/163486/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update unittests and use NamedTemporaryFile

Update the unittests for _make_password_file to text exception handling.
Also switch to using tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile() to create the
temporary file.

The _make_password_file function was corrected so that if an exception
occurred during the 'yield' portion, it would not catch the error and
convert it into a PasswordFileFailedToCreate exception.  The unit tests
are being updated to test this new behavior and also test for when it
should raise a PasswordFileFailedToCreate exception.

Also it was recommended to use tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile() instead of
tempfile.mkstemp()

Partial-Bug: 1428722
Change-Id: Iedb6baa97133d2aa8f88a4aaf2945403766d7fd5

commit_message:
Keystone resource plugin for User

Adds resource plugin for Keystone user

Change-Id: Ifed1b27589e8b6210d4d29cfdf2f11977c303d23
Implements: blueprint keystone-resources
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/65/161565/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from heat.common.i18n import _ from heat.engine import constraints from heat.engine import properties from heat.engine import support from ..resources.role_assignments import KeystoneRoleAssignment # noqa class KeystoneUser(KeystoneRoleAssignment): ''' Heat Template Resource for Keystone User. heat_template_version: 2013-05-23 description: Sample Keystone User template parameters: user_name: type: string description: Keystone user name user_description: type: string description: Keystone user description user_enabled: type: boolean description: Keystone user is enabled or disabled user_domain: type: string description: Keystone user domain name user_emailid: type: string description: Keystone user emailid user_password: type: string description: Keystone user password user_default_project: type: string description: Keystone user default project id user_groups: type: comma_delimited_list description: Keystone groups, where this user is part of group_role: type: string description: role group_role_domain: type: string description: group role domain group_role_project: type: string description: group role project resources: admin_user: type: OS::Keystone::User properties: name: {get_param: user_name} domain: {get_param: user_domain} description: {get_param: user_description} enabled: {get_param: user_enabled} emailid: {get_param: user_emailid} password: {get_param: user_password} default_project: {get_param: user_default_project} groups: {get_param: user_groups} roles: - role: {get_param: group_role} domain: {get_param: group_role_domain} project: {get_param: group_role_project} ''' support_status = support.SupportStatus(version='2015.1') PROPERTIES = ( NAME, DOMAIN, DESCRIPTION, ENABLED, EMAILID, PASSWORD, DEFAULT_PROJECT, GROUPS ) = ( 'name', 'domain', 'description', 'enabled', 'emailid', 'password', 'default_project', 'groups' ) properties_schema = { NAME: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('Name of keystone user.'), update_allowed=True ), DOMAIN: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('Name of keystone domain.'), default='default', constraints=[constraints.CustomConstraint('keystone.domain')] ), DESCRIPTION: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('Description of keystone user.'), default='', update_allowed=True ), ENABLED: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.BOOLEAN, _('Keystone user is enabled or disabled'), default=True, update_allowed=True ), EMAILID: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('Email Id of keystone user.'), update_allowed=True ), PASSWORD: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('Password of keystone user.'), update_allowed=True ), DEFAULT_PROJECT: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('Default project of keystone user.'), update_allowed=True, constraints=[constraints.CustomConstraint('keystone.project')] ), GROUPS: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.LIST, _('keystone user groups.'), update_allowed=True, schema=properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('keystone user group.'), constraints=[constraints.CustomConstraint('keystone.group')] ) ) } (properties_schema.update(KeystoneRoleAssignment.properties_schema)) def _create_user(self, user_name, description, domain, default_project, enabled=None, emailid=None, password=None): domain = (self.client_plugin('keystone'). get_domain_id(domain)) if default_project: default_project = (self.client_plugin('keystone'). get_project_id(default_project)) return self.keystone().client.users.create( name=user_name, domain=domain, description=description, enabled=enabled, email=emailid, password=password, default_project=default_project) def _delete_user(self, user_id): return self.keystone().client.users.delete(user_id) def _update_user(self, user_id, domain, new_name=None, new_description=None, new_emailid=None, new_password=None, new_default_project=None, enabled=None): values = dict() if new_name is not None: values['name'] = new_name if new_description is not None: values['description'] = new_description if new_emailid is not None: values['email'] = new_emailid if new_password is not None: values['password'] = new_password if new_default_project is not None: values['default_project'] = new_default_project if enabled is not None: values['enabled'] = enabled if len(values) == 0: return values['user'] = user_id domain = (self.client_plugin('keystone'). get_domain_id(domain)) values['domain'] = domain return self.keystone().client.users.update(**values) def _add_user_to_groups(self, user_id, groups): group_ids = [(self.client_plugin('keystone'). get_group_id(group)) for group in groups] for group_id in group_ids: self.keystone().client.users.add_to_group(user_id, group_id) def _remove_user_from_groups(self, user_id, groups): group_ids = [(self.client_plugin('keystone'). get_group_id(group)) for group in groups] for group_id in group_ids: self.keystone().client.users.remove_from_group(user_id, group_id) def _find_diff(self, updated_prps, stored_prps): new_group_ids = [(self.client_plugin('keystone'). get_group_id(group)) for group in (set(updated_prps or []) - set(stored_prps or []))] removed_group_ids = [(self.client_plugin('keystone'). get_group_id(group)) for group in (set(stored_prps or []) - set(updated_prps or []))] return new_group_ids, removed_group_ids def handle_create(self): user_name = (self.properties.get(self.NAME) or self.physical_resource_name()) description = self.properties.get(self.DESCRIPTION) domain = self.properties.get(self.DOMAIN) enabled = self.properties.get(self.ENABLED) emailid = self.properties.get(self.EMAILID) password = self.properties.get(self.PASSWORD) default_project = self.properties.get(self.DEFAULT_PROJECT) groups = self.properties.get(self.GROUPS) user = self._create_user( user_name=user_name, description=description, domain=domain, enabled=enabled, emailid=emailid, password=password, default_project=default_project ) self.resource_id_set(user.id) self._add_user_to_groups(user.id, groups) super(KeystoneUser, self).handle_create(user_id=user.id, group_id=None) def handle_update(self, json_snippet=None, tmpl_diff=None, prop_diff=None): name = prop_diff.get(self.NAME) description = prop_diff.get(self.DESCRIPTION) enabled = prop_diff.get(self.ENABLED) emailid = prop_diff.get(self.EMAILID) password = prop_diff.get(self.PASSWORD) domain = self._stored_properties_data.get(self.DOMAIN) default_project = prop_diff.get(self.DEFAULT_PROJECT) (new_group_ids, removed_group_ids) = self._find_diff( prop_diff.get(self.GROUPS), self._stored_properties_data.get(self.GROUPS)) self._update_user( user_id=self.resource_id, domain=domain, new_name=name, new_description=description, enabled=enabled, new_default_project=default_project, new_emailid=emailid, new_password=password ) if len(new_group_ids) > 0: self._add_user_to_groups(self.resource_id, new_group_ids) if len(removed_group_ids) > 0: self._remove_user_from_groups(self.resource_id, removed_group_ids) super(KeystoneUser, self).handle_update(user_id=self.resource_id, group_id=None, prop_diff=prop_diff) def handle_delete(self): if self.resource_id is not None: try: super(KeystoneUser, self).handle_delete( user_id=None, group_id=self.resource_id) if self._stored_properties_data[self.GROUPS] is not None: self._remove_user_from_groups( self.resource_id, [(self.client_plugin('keystone'). get_group_id(group)) for group in self._stored_properties_data[self.GROUPS]]) self._delete_user(user_id=self.resource_id) except Exception as ex: self.client_plugin('keystone').ignore_not_found(ex) def resource_mapping(): return { 'OS::Keystone::User': KeystoneUser }

commit_message:
Update test to fail instead of skip if floating pool is already allocated

The FloatingIPsBulkAdminTestJSON skips instead of fail if the pool is already configured.
This patch updates the test to fail when the floating pool is found to be already configured.

Change-Id: Iee5317c174c9abfc3514b6833d35e17969b15693
Closes-Bug: #1401280
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/52/161352/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest import exceptions raise exceptions.InvalidConfiguration(msg)
deleted_lines: raise cls.skipException(msg)

commit_message:
IPA: Add support for root device hints

This patch is adding support for root device hints on IPA. It also moves
the related functions that was on iscsi_deploy.py (used only by the PXE
drivers) to a common place (deploy_utils.py).

Depends-On: I2b00b3fb3b61001033750dd8951f9353d6f2e361
Change-Id: Ie9caa685e5bf60f0c22d253206f5f141291a2c10

commit_message:
Metavar name should be hyphenated

The commit Ifd97696a22c0c79687a0190ec13f827467286e2e
accidentally undid the change that hyphenated metavar
names. This puts the hyphen back.

Change-Id: I36a4e857f023e0bea1781ab64e883b677d8c2410

commit_message:
Heat resource url mapping improvement

This patch set adds a few resource types to resource
url mapping to make proper links to resources from
stacks details.

Partially implements blueprint: heat-ui-improvement

Change-Id: I829c586b75c9b4c15dcf58ea317cf28eddec182b

urllib is incompatible for python 3.

commit_message:
Refactor, customization and fixes of Metadata Widget

Allow customization of strings in Metadata Widget by extracting them
from template to separate service.

Fix alignment of filter boxes when longer text is provided as column
title. Fix available filter only showing expanded items. Fix level-0
item showing in available list when all level-2 leafs was added
manually.

Make the tree logic reusable by extracting it into service.

Closes-Bug: 1394472
Change-Id: I88f4d008f4c814747028585842769aff26ff9936

subject: Remove global mocking from test_pure.py
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-11 09:37:31.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_pure.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/3947faca85c221f3373840bf1ab54b20a8fed4c6', 'message': 'Remove global mocking from test_pure.py

Tests for pure driver are patching cinder.utils.retry globally. All
tests running after test_pure got imported have retry decorator already
mocked. This creates problems when writing new unit tests involving the
decorator. This change unpatches cinder.utils.retry after test_pure
imports pure driver.

Change-Id: Ie9cbe6ffb3cfcaba5a296b5083974696117b99bb
Closes-Bug: 1430699
'}]
commit_message:
Remove global mocking from test_pure.py

Tests for pure driver are patching cinder.utils.retry globally. All
tests running after test_pure got imported have retry decorator already
mocked. This creates problems when writing new unit tests involving the
decorator. This change unpatches cinder.utils.retry after test_pure
imports pure driver.

Change-Id: Ie9cbe6ffb3cfcaba5a296b5083974696117b99bb
Closes-Bug: 1430699
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/36/163336/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: mock.patch('cinder.utils.retry', fake_retry).start()

commit_message:
Use labels for virtual media dev in agent ramdisk

This commit changes agent deploy ramdisk to find out
the virtual media device by using labels instead of
looking at the model of block device.  This helps in
finding out the device irrespective of the hardware.

Corresponding Ironic change is
If5b78d9af7048f2631d050ee5ce01ab7a67e2354.

Closes-Bug: 1429340
Change-Id: Ib6cc226dc4fb341d913f707737493c31a3f77152

Remove # this after L release. vmedia_device = _get_vmedia_device() if not vmedia_device: msg = "Unable to find virtual media device" raise errors.VirtualMediaBootError(msg) vmedia_device_file = os.path.join("/dev", vmedia_device)

commit_message:
Edge router spec

Spec for the edge router advanced service that includes the
following features:

 * Edge router management
 * Edge router port management
 * Edge router route management

Change-Id: If00bd271d0be9b893e8d0efbf93ff07b62d7f8ff
Fixes: MNP-32
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/98/162398/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/ =================================== Provider Router and Router Port API =================================== In MidoNet, a router owned by the admin of the cloud called 'provider router' is created implicitly when the first extenal network is created in neutron. Provider router is a singleton object, and there is always only one that exists in the system, no matter how many external networks are created. The motivation behind this router is that it conforms to the most typical MidoNet virtual topology design in that there is a router sitting at the edge of the cloud providing external connectivity (through BGP or static routes), and internal connectivity among tenants through its routing table. This document describes the Neutron extension API for provider router and provider router port management. The document does NOT cover the following topics: * How routes and BGP are configured on the provider router * How ACL is applied on the provider router * How router ports are bound to physical interfaces They will be addressed in separate specs. Problem Description =================== Even though the provider router is implicitly created behind the scenes, the operator still needs to access the router to configure static and dynamic routes, ACL and to be able to create and bind its ports to physical interfaces. Currently there is no API in Neutron to provide access to the provider router and its ports. Proposed Change =============== To provide access to the provider router and its ports using Neutron API, the provider router and the ports are stored in the Neutron database, and new extension API are defined. Provider Router --------------- Neutron plugin would ensure that there is only one provider router in the system when an external network is created. A new database table called 'midonet_provider_router' is created where the singleton provider router is stored. The provider router does not get inserted into the 'routers' table in Neutron since there is no obvious benefit to doing so, and it will be trivial to change this design in the future. A new task resource PROVIDER_ROUTER is introduced to represent the provider router. Router Port ----------- Currently the only type of port that belongs in MidoNet that does not belong in Neutron is the router port on the provider router. Neutron does not expose any API to tenants to manage the ports on the tenant router, but with the provider router extension, the operators now need to manage the routers on the provider router to set up basic network configurations (routing, ACL, etc), as well as binding to a physical host. A new database table called 'midonet_router_ports' is created where the router ports that only belong to MidoNet are stored. A new task resouce type, ROUTER_PORT, is introduced to represent a port on a router. While the API does not prevent you from creating a port on tenant routers, since there are no tenant-facing API that could take advantage of these ports, the API is made available only to admins. REST API -------- **ProviderRouter** +--------------+------+-------+---------+-------------------------------------+ |Attribute |Type |POST/ |Required |Description | |Name | |PUT | | | +==============+======+=======+=========+=====================================+ |id |string| |generated|ID of the providre router | +--------------+------+-------+---------+-------------------------------------+ |name |string|POST/ |No |Name of the provider router | | | |PUT | | | +--------------+------+-------+---------+-------------------------------------+ |admin_state_up|string|POST/ |No |Administrative state of the router | | | |PUT | | | +--------------+------+-------+---------+-------------------------------------+ |tenant_id |string|POST |Yes |Tenant that created the router. | | | | | |Must be admin of the tenant to create| | | | | |this router. | +--------------+------+-------+---------+-------------------------------------+ **RouterPort** +--------------+------+-------+---------+-------------------------------------+ |Attribute |Type |POST/ |Required |Description | |Name | |PUT | | | +==============+======+=======+=========+=====================================+ |id |string|POST |generated|ID of the router port | +--------------+------+-------+---------+-------------------------------------+ |router_id |UUID |POST |Yes |ID of the router this port belogngs | | | | | |to | +--------------+------+-------+---------+-------------------------------------+ |name |string|POST/ |No |Name of the router port | | | |PUT | | | +--------------+------+-------+---------+-------------------------------------+ |tenant_id |string|POST |Yes |Tenant that created the port | | | | | |Must be admin of the tenant to create| | | | | |this router. | +--------------+------+-------+---------+-------------------------------------+ |ip_address |string|POST/ |Yes |IP address of the router port. | | | |PUT | |Only IPv4 address is supported. | | | | | |The format is 'X.X.X.X' | +--------------+------+-------+---------+-------------------------------------+ |mac_address |string|POST/ |Yes |MAC address of the router port | | | |PUT | |The format is 'XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX' | +--------------+------+-------+---------+-------------------------------------+ For this proposal, only admins are allowed to create router ports because there are no tenant API availale in Neutron that could take advantage of these ports. DB Model -------- **midonet_provider_router** As the name implies, this table only stores the singleton provider router. When the provider router is created, an entry is added to the Neutron's 'routers' table also. By treating the providing router as a regular Neutron router, it is possible to have router ports (described below) belonging to not only the provider router but also tenant routers. +-------------------+------------+--------------------------------------------+ | Name | Type | Description | +===================+============+============================================+ | id | UUID | ID of the provider router | +-------------------+------------+--------------------------------------------+ | name | String(255)| Name of the provider router | +-------------------+------------+--------------------------------------------+ | admin_state_up | Boolean | Administrative state of the router | +-------------------+------------+--------------------------------------------+ **midonet_router_ports** Since there is no concrete case to store non-router ports, the table is designed to only store router ports. Changing this design to more generic port table should be trivial if such design is demanded. +-------------------+-----------+---------------------------------------------+ | Name | Type | Description | +===================+===========+=============================================+ | id | UUID | ID of the port | +-------------------+-----------+---------------------------------------------+ | router_id | UUID | ID of the router the port belongs to | +-------------------+-----------+---------------------------------------------+ | ip_address | String(64)| IP address assigned to this port | +-------------------+-----------+---------------------------------------------+ | mac_address | String(32)| MAC address assigned to this port | +-------------------+-----------+---------------------------------------------+ Currently, due to limitation in MidoNet, only one IPv4 address can be assigend to a port. **midonet_tasks** New task data types, PROVIDER_ROUTER and ROUTER_PORT are introduced. Security -------- Only admins can create an external network, so the provider router is always owned by the admin. Tenants do not have the privilege to modify the router. Likewise, only admins can create router ports, but only because there are no tenant facing API that could take advantage of these ports. Client ------ The following command gets the provider router: :: neutron provider-router-get [-h] -h, --help:: show the help message The following command updates the provider router: :: neutron provider-router-update [-h] [--name NAME] [--admin-state-up] [--admin-state-down] -h, --help:: show the help message --name NAME:: name of the provider router --admin-state-down:: sets admin state to down --admin-state-up:: sets admin state to up The following command creates a router port on a router: :: neutron router-port-create [-h] [--router-id ROUTER_ID] [--name NAME] [--ip-address IP_ADDRESS] [--mac-address MAC_ADDRESS] [--tenant-id TENANT_ID] -h, --help:: show the help message --router ROUTER_ID:: ID of the router to add a port to --name NAME:: Name of the port --ip-address IP_ADDRESS:: IP address in 'X.X.X.X' format --mac-address MAC_ADDRESS:: MAC address in 'XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX' format --tenant-id TENANT_ID:: The owner tenant ID The following command gets a router port: :: neutron router-port-show [-h] PORT -h, --help:: show the help message PORT:: ID of the port to look up The following command gets a list of ports that belong to a given tenant (this is the standard for the list commands in neutron client): :: neutron router-port-list [-h] [-P SIZE] [--sort-key FIELD] [--sort-dir {asc, desc}] -h, --help:: show the help message -P SIZE, --page-size SIZE:: Specify retrieve unit of each request --sort-key FIELD:: Sorts the list by the specified fields --sort-dir {asc,desc}:: Sorts the list in the specified direction The following command updates a router port: :: neutron router-port-update [-h] [--ip-address IP_ADDRESS] [--name NAME] [--mac-address MAC_ADDRESS] PORT -h, --help:: show the help message PORT:: ID of the port to update --name NAME:: Name of the port --ip-address IP_ADDRESS:: IP address in 'X.X.X.X' format --mac-address MAC_ADDRESS:: MAC address in 'XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX' format The following command deletes a router port: :: neutron router-port-delete [-h] PORT -h, --help:: show the help message PORT:: ID of the port to update

commit_message:
Prevent flash of left nav panels when loading page

In the left nav, only the panel group containing the panel for the current page
should be expanded. However, in the Chrome browser, all other panels in the
same dashboard are momentarily shown before being hidden. The flash of content
happens in the time between the page's template rendering the panels and the
JavaScript being run to hide the non-active panels. Prevent the flash by hiding
non-active panels in the template instead of using JavaScript to hide the
panels later.

Closes-Bug: 1408513
Change-Id: I8fde47f4a0d6b7415998cf84fa4974bbe39728eb

subject: VPNaaS breakage by refactoring commit
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-10 02:16:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/81106458163206cf40bee938dea06710d9ccd652', 'message': 'VPNaaS breakage by refactoring commit

The refactoring commit 56fd82 moves router_info and NAT rules
staffs from l3-agent into vpn device driver, which cause
breakage due to the following two problems:

1, The router is maintained in the driver, and not the VPN
   service. The router instance should not be deleted.

2, NAT rules staffs has been moved from l3-agent into vpn device
   driver, but something is still refering NAT rules related
   methods from l3-agent.

In any case, we need this change in ASAP.

Change-Id: Ibdbf5ef9db1b7b1ab438ecb8de9cce5ec2f8f62e
Closes-Bug: 1430100

commit_message:
VPNaaS breakage by refactoring commit

The refactoring commit [1] moves router_info and NAT rules
code from l3-agent into vpn device driver, which cause
breakage due to the following two problems:

1, The router is maintained in the driver, and not the VPN
   service. The router instance should not be deleted.

2, NAT rules code has been moved from l3-agent into vpn device
   driver, but something is still refering NAT rules related
   methods from l3-agent.

In any case, we need this change in ASAP.

[1], https://review.openstack.org/#/c/160179/

Change-Id: Ibdbf5ef9db1b7b1ab438ecb8de9cce5ec2f8f62e
Closes-Bug: 1430100

added_lines: self.iptables_apply(router_id) self._update_nat(process.vpnservice, self.add_nat_rule) def destroy_process(self, process_id): """Destroy process. Disable the process, remove the nat rule, and remove the process manager for the processes that no longer are running vpn service. """ if process_id in self.processes: process = self.processes[process_id] process.disable() vpnservice = process.vpnservice if vpnservice: self._update_nat(vpnservice, self.remove_nat_rule) del self.processes[process_id] self.destroy_process(process_id) self._update_nat(vpnservice, self.add_nat_rule) self.destroy_process(process_id)
deleted_lines: self.agent.iptables_apply(router_id) self._update_nat(process.vpnservice, self.agent.add_nat_rule) if process_id in self.processes: process = self.processes[process_id] process.disable() vpnservice = process.vpnservice if vpnservice: self._update_nat(vpnservice, self.agent.remove_nat_rule) del self.processes[process_id] self._delete_vpn_processes(sync_router_ids, router_ids) self._update_nat(vpnservice, self.agent.add_nat_rule) def _delete_vpn_processes(self, sync_router_ids, vpn_router_ids): # Delete any IPSec processes that are # associated with routers, but are not running the VPN service. for process_id in sync_router_ids: if process_id not in vpn_router_ids: self.ensure_process(process_id) self.destroy_router(process_id) self.destroy_router(process_id)

commit_message:
Fixup log message for discoverd

Change the startup log message for "discoverd is disabled"
from WARN to INFO.
- this matches other startup log messages about drivers
- it's not a warning when the operator chooses to disable something

Change-Id: I58ee7e5b1558840b45de21e70af85de1fbc246d8

deleted_lines: from ironic.common.i18n import _LW LOG.warn(_LW("Inspection via ironic-discoverd is disabled in " "configuration for driver %s, set " "[discoverd]enabled = true to enable"), driver_name)

commit_message:
Bump PyECLib version to >= 1.0.3

ECPyECLibException has been removed in 1.0.1, among other
API/error handling enhancements in 1.0.3. Let's make sure
the right version is used.

Change-Id: Ie6e0c1b491017dd5096b14c23b610abc22b03d6a

commit_message:
Replication V2

The V2 implentation of replication, including:
  - promote-to-replica-source
  - eject-replica-source

Implements: blueprint replication-v2

Change-Id: I9075365a8fae754e29d27d6e371a1d8c8980e26b
Authored-By: Morgan Jones <morgan@parelastic.com>
Co-Authored-By: Peter Stachowski <peter@tesora.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-troveclient refs/changes/81/164281/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def promote_to_replica_source(self, instance): """Promote a replica to be the new replica_source of its set :param instance: The :class:`Instance` (or its ID) of the database instance to promote. """ body = {'promote_to_replica_source': {}} self._action(instance, body) def eject_replica_source(self, instance): """Eject a replica source from its set :param instance: The :class:`Instance` (or its ID) of the database instance to eject. """ body = {'eject_replica_source': {}} self._action(instance, body) PROMOTING = "PROMOTING" EJECTING = "EJECTING"

commit_message:
Simplify and improve bootstrap/gate/run scripts

Originally the gate check scripts were built in such a way that they
could cater for all branches with the same script. This no longer needs
to be the case as the gate checks are acknowledged to be branch-specific.

The necessary bits to cater for the other branches have now be removed
to simplify the scripts.

Also, in master all environment variables are exported, which helps with
ensuring that the variables are present when other scripts are also run.
This is a better practise and has been included in the script clean-up.

Change-Id: Ie0c05b1b94d167f296f0449531e76b16010fe1c0
Closes-Bug: #1431361

added_lines: export GET_PIP_URL="${GET_PIP_URL:-https://mirror.rackspace.com/rackspaceprivatecloud/downloads/get-pip.py}"# Use pip to install ansible pip install ansible==1.6.10
deleted_lines: ANSIBLE_DEPLOY_METHOD="pip" ANSIBLE_GIT_REPO="https://github.com/ansible/ansible" ANSIBLE_GIT_RELEASE="${ANSIBLE_GIT_RELEASE:-1.6.10}" ANSIBLE_WORKING_DIR="/opt/ansible_v${ANSIBLE_GIT_RELEASE}" GET_PIP_URL="${GET_PIP_URL:-https://mirror.rackspace.com/rackspaceprivatecloud/downloads/get-pip.py}"if [ "${ANSIBLE_DEPLOY_METHOD}" == "git" ]; then # If the working directory exists remove it if [ -d "${ANSIBLE_WORKING_DIR}" ];then rm -rf "${ANSIBLE_WORKING_DIR}" fi # Clone down the base ansible source git clone "${ANSIBLE_GIT_REPO}" "${ANSIBLE_WORKING_DIR}" pushd "${ANSIBLE_WORKING_DIR}" git checkout "v${ANSIBLE_GIT_RELEASE}" git submodule update --init --recursive popd # Install requirements if there are any if [ -f "${ANSIBLE_WORKING_DIR}/requirements.txt" ];then pip2 install -r "${ANSIBLE_WORKING_DIR}/requirements.txt" || pip install -r "${ANSIBLE_WORKING_DIR}/requirements.txt" fi # Install ansible pip2 install "${ANSIBLE_WORKING_DIR}" || pip install "${ANSIBLE_WORKING_DIR}" else # Use pip to install ansible pip install ansible==${ANSIBLE_GIT_RELEASE} fi

commit_message:
Fix OS::Zaqar::Queue resource_mapping

Documentation generating about OS::Zaqar::Queue was broken
because of incorrect resource_mapping. This patch fixes this
situation and returns OS::Zaqar::Queue to docs.

Change-Id: I7dadf9f3916afa2ee2c9540ab744cf9776cad315
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/65/164665/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def resource_mapping(): return { 'OS::Zaqar::Queue': ZaqarQueue, } def available_resource_mapping(): if not clients.has_client('zaqar'): return {} return resource_mapping()
deleted_lines: def resource_mapping(): if not clients.has_client('zaqar'): return {} return { 'OS::Zaqar::Queue': ZaqarQueue, }

commit_message:
Separate message and traceback even if not a remote error

Faultwrap exposes tracebacks in error messages when Oslo.messaging
cannot add a _remote suffix to the exception generated by the Heat
engine.

Change-Id: Iaf91dafacce1abe94fb10aa2ba380cafb6fc4a84
closes-bug: #1432726

def test_http_exception_with_traceback(self): wrapper = fault.FaultWrapper(None) newline_error = ErrorWithNewline( 'Error with 
 newline
Traceback (most recent call last):
Foo') msg = wrapper._error(heat_exc.HTTPExceptionDisguise(newline_error)) expected = {'code': 400, 'error': {'message': 'Error with 
 newline', 'traceback': None, 'type': 'ErrorWithNewline'}, 'explanation': ('The server could not comply with the ' 'request since it is either malformed ' 'or otherwise incorrect.'), 'title': 'Bad Request'} self.assertEqual(expected, msg)

commit_message:
Add missing versioned mechanism to Stack object

Few object methods misses _from_db_object. To enable it to make
schema valid, we need to fix that.

Change-Id: I2e5ff22cd40be56ebc5f3a7095887be773ddb809
Closes-Bug: #1431353
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/82/164682/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: stack[field] = db_stack.__dict__.get(field) db_stack = db_api.stack_get_by_name_and_owner_id( context, stack_name, owner_id ) if not db_stack: return db_stack stack = cls._from_db_object(context, cls(context), db_stack) return stack db_stack = db_api.stack_get_by_name(context, stack_name) if not db_stack: return db_stack stack = cls._from_db_object(context, cls(context), db_stack) return stack db_stacks = db_api.stack_get_all(context, *args, **kwargs) stacks = map( lambda db_stack: cls._from_db_object( context, cls(context), db_stack), db_stacks) return stacks db_stacks = db_api.stack_get_all_by_owner_id(context, owner_id) stacks = map( lambda db_stack: cls._from_db_object( context, cls(context), db_stack), db_stacks) return stacks
deleted_lines: stack[field] = db_stack[field] return db_api.stack_get_by_name_and_owner_id(context, stack_name, owner_id) return db_api.stack_get_by_name(context, stack_name) return db_api.stack_get_all(context, *args, **kwargs) return db_api.stack_get_all_by_owner_id(context, owner_id)

commit_message:
Move Unix domain socket helpers to a common place

As part of the all consuming report-ha-router-master, a new
per router neutron-keepalived-state-change daemon will alert
the L3 agent on every keepalived state change. Since it will
use the Unix domain socket helpers, and they're currently
located in metadata related places, this patch moves them
to a common location.

Also, the UnixDomainHTTPConnection connection string
may now be overridden.

Partially-Implements: blueprint report-ha-router-master
Change-Id: Ib2cde90059f4e089064b2def2838e9bcf9af30de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/32/164032/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_config import cfg import socket class TestUnixDomainHttpConnection(base.BaseTestCase): def test_connect(self): cfg.CONF.register_opt(cfg.StrOpt('metadata_proxy_socket')) cfg.CONF.metadata_proxy_socket = '/the/path' with mock.patch('socket.socket') as socket_create: conn = utils.UnixDomainHTTPConnection('169.254.169.254', timeout=3) conn.connect() socket_create.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(socket.AF_UNIX, socket.SOCK_STREAM), mock.call().settimeout(3), mock.call().connect('/the/path')] ) self.assertEqual(conn.timeout, 3) class TestUnixDomainHttpProtocol(base.BaseTestCase): def test_init_empty_client(self): u = utils.UnixDomainHttpProtocol(mock.Mock(), '', mock.Mock()) self.assertEqual(u.client_address, ('<local>', 0)) def test_init_with_client(self): u = utils.UnixDomainHttpProtocol(mock.Mock(), 'foo', mock.Mock()) self.assertEqual(u.client_address, 'foo') class TestUnixDomainWSGIServer(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestUnixDomainWSGIServer, self).setUp() self.eventlet_p = mock.patch.object(utils, 'eventlet') self.eventlet = self.eventlet_p.start() self.server = utils.UnixDomainWSGIServer('test') def test_start(self): mock_app = mock.Mock() with mock.patch.object(self.server, '_launch') as launcher: self.server.start(mock_app, '/the/path', workers=5, backlog=128) self.eventlet.assert_has_calls([ mock.call.listen( '/the/path', family=socket.AF_UNIX, backlog=128 )] ) launcher.assert_called_once_with(mock_app, workers=5) def test_run(self): self.server._run('app', 'sock') self.eventlet.wsgi.server.assert_called_once_with( 'sock', 'app', protocol=utils.UnixDomainHttpProtocol, log=mock.ANY, custom_pool=self.server.pool )

commit_message:
VMware:Use datastore selection logic in new module

Volumes created by the VMDK driver are stored in vCenter
managed datastores. A datastore is selected based on
requirements such as size, storage policy etc. Commit
2c672d1100ad4f44517838e17156b3ea6300b1cc introduced a
new module for datastore selection. It improved the
current logic and grouped the code which were scattered
in multiple places (in vmdk.py). This patch refactors
vmdk module to remove duplicate code and use the methods
in the new module.

Change-Id: I3b7cb8bd33ced2f9deed2936a9c02feb90fb70b7

VMware: Refactor initialize_connection unit tests

This patch refactors initialize_connection unit tests
to use mock.

Partial-Bug: #1261097
Change-Id: I9a1a50526d038c0a9c17d0015f00b4bf27d68131

m.StubOutWithMock(self._volumeops, 'get_datastore') self._volumeops.get_datastore(backing).AndReturn(datastore2) m.StubOutWithMock(self._driver, '_get_folder_ds_summary') folder = FakeMor('Folder', 'my_fol') summary = FakeDatastoreSummary(1, 1, datastore1) self._driver._get_folder_ds_summary(volume, resource_pool, [datastore1]).AndReturn((folder, summary)) m.StubOutWithMock(self._volumeops, 'relocate_backing') self._volumeops.relocate_backing(backing, datastore1, resource_pool, host) m.StubOutWithMock(self._volumeops, 'move_backing_to_folder') self._volumeops.move_backing_to_folder(backing, folder) m.ReplayAll() conn_info = self._driver.initialize_connection(volume, connector) self.assertEqual(conn_info['driver_volume_type'], 'vmdk') self.assertEqual(conn_info['data']['volume'], 'my_back') self.assertEqual(conn_info['data']['volume_id'], 'volume_id') m.UnsetStubs() m.VerifyAll()

This patch allows the SQLAlchemy DB API to talk to any arbitrary
database. It allows augmenting existing request context with the connection
information of the target database and the uses the augmented context to
instantiate the SQLAlchemy engine/session objects.
If the default unaugmented context is used, the DB API connects to the database
specified in the configuration file.

A new config option to distinguish the api database from the main
database has been added.

commit_message:
Add support for multiple database engines

This allows for the creation and use of multiple database engines.
nova-manage database commands will be able to use the proper database
connection string based on which database they're intended to work with.
This removes the overloaded use of CONF.database.connection to point at
the api or main database, and any potential confusion that could result.

A new config group 'api_database' has been added with the following
options which are used when creating a sqlalchemy engine:

connection, sqlite_synchronous, slave_connection, mysql_sql_mode,
idle_timeout, max_pool_size, max_retries, retry_interval, max_overflow,
connection_debug, connection_trace, pool_timeout

DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Andrew Laski <andrew.laski@rackspace.com>
Change-Id: Ibd197ec431b052e9c4b3fb05bc4f44ee2f3fbdd4
Partially-Implements: bp cells-v2-mapping
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/66/159266/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: api_db_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt('connection', help='The SQLAlchemy connection string to use to connect to ' 'the Nova API database.', secret=True) ] CONF.register_opts(api_db_opts, group='api_database')def _connection_url(context, database): if CONF.database.connection and CONF.api_database: LOG.warning("Config options '[database] connection' and " "'[api_database] connection' should not both be set.") if connection_url is None: if database == 'main': connection_url = CONF.database.connection elif database == 'api': connection_url = CONF.api_database.connection return connection_url def get_engine(use_slave=False, context=None, database='main'): connection_url = _connection_url(context, database) connection_url = _connection_url(context)
deleted_lines: def get_engine(use_slave=False, context=None): connection_url = _url_from_context(context)

commit_message:
Fixes session persistence validation error

Adds new exception for session persistence
Updates session persistence validation to use new exception

Change-Id: Ibafed9b324c77636f5553059abbb69f3c0c5f5b5
Closes-Bug: #1430541

added_lines: class SessionPersistenceConfigurationInvalid(nexception.BadRequest): message = _("Session Persistence Invalid: %(msg)s")

subject: Translate semi-colon into newline when parsing $DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-16 22:54:29.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate/commit/04554e04524b1399645eb928b9ae741c26c5646b', 'message': "Translate semi-colon into newline when parsing $DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG

In cases when $DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG contains multiple values separated
by ';' split them up into multiple lines. This makes for a much
more readable local.rc file.

Change-Id: I5a1d0932f369b1e0d8c0039e09eaea2ee43b86de
"}]
commit_message:
Translate semi-colon into newline when parsing $DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG

In cases when $DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG contains multiple values separated
by ';' split them up into multiple lines. This makes for a much
more readable local.rc file.

Change-Id: I5a1d0932f369b1e0d8c0039e09eaea2ee43b86de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/95/164895/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "$DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG" | tr ';' '\n' >>"$localrc_file"
deleted_lines: echo "$DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG" >>"$localrc_file"

commit_message:
Update cryptography to >= 0.7

Keystone fernet token feature uses cryptography MultiFernet,
which is available after cryptography 0.7.

Change-Id: Ia9acc142cd8c02e401edfca4e31e53b8658ea231

deleted_lines: cryptography>=0.4 # Apache-2.0

commit_message:
Launch Instance Step - Select Source

This is the first step in launch instance wizard work flow.

Co-Authored-By: Brian Tully <brian.tully@hp.com>
Partially Implements: blueprint launch-instance-redesign
Change-Id: Iee47830cd848516abaf7cdbd79573bdfca769d38

deleted_lines: $scope.title = gettext('Instance Details');

commit_message:
Add description option to policy config

This patch provides for an optional 'description' that can
be included in a policy config section. The value of this
description is included in the policy info returned in response
to a capabilities/info request.

The description value is limited to a maximum of 4096 characters.

NOTE: The StoragePolicy parser does not tolerate unexpected options
in the policy sections of swift.conf, which means that code must be
upgraded with this patch in every service that might load policies
before adding description options to swift.conf.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I9ba2b1c296e2e8ecd52424026fc02a451367b60b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/24/120424/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

`should_cache_fn` on the decorator now is called `should_cache` and
the `expiration_time_fn` is called `get_expiration_time`. The

Change-Id: I19c50f1fa1fff56f04944bedf58c9438e4115322

commit_message:
Address nits for default cache time more explicit

This addresses minor nits in naming of functions when the cache
time was made more explicit in code via refactor. Notably the
`should_cache_fn` on the decorator now is called `should_cache` and
the `expiration_time_fn` is called `get_expiration_time`. The
declairation of the memoizing decorator in keystone.token.provider
has been made consistent with other uses by utilizing the `section`
kwarg instead of passing it as positional.

Change-Id: I19c50f1fa1fff56f04944bedf58c9438e4115322
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/15/162815/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: setattr(memoize, 'should_cache_fn', should_cache) setattr(memoize, 'expiration_time_fn', expiration_time)

commit_message:
Do not generate index.html if one exists

There are sources of machine generated content other than the zuul swift
upload script. These generators may also create index.html files for us,
if they do preserve the original index.html and do not create a new one.

Change-Id: I9785c4d42d0e0693789976b408d0118c4ea63e50

commit_message:
Remove jobs for Gerrit 2.4.x

We don't need to build our Gerrit 2.4.x fork anymore since we've
been running on Gerrit 2.8.x for the last few years.

Change-Id: Ic6136d8749eb375ea229895fa6222622a8b8b8fd

commit_message:
Stop running useless tests on horizon

We have a single tempest test for horizon that just logs in. Neutron or
different DBs ac not possibly make that test fail.

Leave a single dsvm-full and grenade.

Change-Id: Ia399d72794154634154050a22c7721c42bd2fad5

To avoid confusion, make the cache time and cache toggle for a
given subsystem configurable via the more friendly
`get_memoization_decorator`. This has the added benefit of
making the resulting decorated methods easier to read as they
are only decorated with the resulting function not needing
the decorator with the same arguments repeatedly.

This change also creates the `get_expiration_time_fn` function
that better describes the fallthrough behavior of the [cache]
expriration_time config value.

This patch updates the revocation event cache time to be in the
proper [revoke] section of the config for consistency with the
other sections.

Co-Authored-By: Morgan Fainberg <morgan.fainberg@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I5c4e5f509ab82b060938591655e6c615ac7d38dd
'}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2014-11-21 20:19:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/98352fa8b7f28e1da3c9287f45997a30273f2250', 'message': 'Make the default cache time more explicit in code

To avoid confusion, make the cache time and cache toggle for a
given subsystem configurable via the more friendly
`get_memoization_decorator`. This has the added benefit of
making the resulting decorated methods easier to read as they
are only decorated with the resulting function not needing
the decorator with the same arguments repeatedly.

This change also creates the `get_expiration_time_fn` function
that better describes the fallthrough behavior of the [cache]
expriration_time config value.

This patch updates the revocation event cache time to be in the
proper [revoke] section of the config for consistency with the
other sections.

DocImpact: revocation_cache_time moved from [token] config section to[revoke]/cache_time

commit_message:
Make the default cache time more explicit in code

To avoid confusion, make the cache time and cache toggle for a
given subsystem configurable via the more friendly
`get_memoization_decorator`. This has the added benefit of
making the resulting decorated methods easier to read as they
are only decorated with the resulting function not needing
the decorator with the same arguments repeatedly.

This change also creates the `get_expiration_time_fn` function
that better describes the fallthrough behavior of the [cache]
expiration_time config value.

This patch updates the revocation event cache time to be in the
proper [revoke] section of the config for consistency with the
other sections.

DocImpact: revocation_cache_time moved from [token] config
section to [revoke]/cache_time

Co-Authored-By: David Stanek <dstanek@dstanek.com>
Change-Id: I5c4e5f509ab82b060938591655e6c615ac7d38dd

commit_message:
Use job templates for gerritlib builds

Change to using templates to run gerritlib builds.  This will add the
python3, doc and tarball jobs.

Change-Id: I025c3a189e5873434e5c444a44e1d91a20b2ade0

commit_message:
make swift-init skip things if config does not have section

Currently what happens is the pid file gets created, the server does
not start because the section is not there and then the pid file just
stays there.

Change-Id: Ia3098895179063fa9105c546ce392c4505519b57

commit_message:
test: Use gabbi tests on live gnocchi-api

This change launches the gabbi tests suite on a real gnocchi-api
deployed with devstack but without the keystone middleware enabled.

Change-Id: I7d48bdd456406b89535e2351282e2bc6a0d6680b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/64/163064/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: host = os.getenv('GABBI_GNOCCHI_HOST') if host: port = os.getenv('GABBI_GNOCCHI_PORT', 8041) return driver.build_tests(test_dir, loader, host=host, port=port) else: return driver.build_tests(test_dir, loader, host=None, intercept=fixtures.setup_app, fixture_module=fixtures)
deleted_lines: return driver.build_tests(test_dir, loader, host=None, intercept=fixtures.setup_app, fixture_module=fixtures)

commit_message:
Fix host listing in live migration

The live migration selector needs to offer a list
of hosts, not a list of hypervisors.

Conflicts:
	openstack_dashboard/test/test_data/nova_data.py

Change-Id: I73c1175a5f87b0f91e36083f05467c26feca5d51
Closes-Bug: #1335999
(cherry picked from commit 89dc7de2e87b8d4e35837ad5122117aa2fb2c520)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/21/149621/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return api.nova.host_list(self.request) msg = _('Unable to retrieve host information.')
deleted_lines: return api.nova.hypervisor_list(self.request) msg = _('Unable to retrieve hypervisor information.')

commit_message:
cinder list now prints dash '-' when data is None

cinder list used to print None when volume was created without name.
Now it prints '-' dash when display_name is None

commit_message:
Update to change name for volume type client

This continues to update the name for volume type:

* Update a client method for volume type.
  update: to update an existing volume type's name

* Update a command-line operations.
  type-update: (adminitrator only) to update a volume type name

The corresponding cinder APIs change to update volume type name:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/140906/

Implements: blueprint volume-type-description
Change-Id: I66adb7fd2a433e7443cb609046f64dbab3d9d4c7

deleted_lines: t = cs.volume_types.update('1', 'test_desc_1')

subject: Bump PyECLib version to >= 1.0.1
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-13 13:28:36.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/c07df6d3f87eb7ada81ceaf9fa5a4dc811ab568b', 'message': "Bump PyECLib version to >= 1.0.1

ECPyECLibException has been removed in 1.0.1,
let's make sure the right version is used.

Change-Id: Ie6e0c1b491017dd5096b14c23b610abc22b03d6a

commit_message:
Bump PyECLib version to >= 1.0.1

ECPyECLibException has been removed in 1.0.1,
let's make sure the right version is used.

Change-Id: Ie6e0c1b491017dd5096b14c23b610abc22b03d6a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/72/164172/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pyeclib>=1.0.1
deleted_lines: pyeclib>=0.9.2
